23:04, 8 February 2016 (UTC) }} '''Heurelho da Silva Gomes''' (born 15 February 1981), better known as '''Heurelho Gomes''', is a Brazilian professional footballer who plays as a [[Goalkeeper (association football)|goalkeeper]] for [[Watford F.C.|Watford]]. He previously made a name for himself at Dutch club [[PSV Eindhoven|PSV]], and also spent six years at [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]].
==Club career==
===Cruzeiro=== Gomes began as a [[forward (association football)|forward]], only becoming a [[goalkeeper (association football)|goalkeeper]] at age 19.<ref>{{cite news|first=Adam|last=Bate|title=Alisson, Ederson, and the rising reputation of Brazilian 'keepers|accessdate=3 October 2018|date=3 October 2018|work=Sky Sports|publisher=British Sky Broadcasting|url=https://www.skysports.com/football/news/11661/11513746/alisson-ederson-and-the-rising-reputation-of-brazilian-keepers}}</ref> Gomes started his career in his native country Brazil at [[Cruzeiro Esporte Clube|Cruzeiro]], where he played 59 games between 2001 and 2004. Here, he was scouted by [[Piet de Visser (football manager)|Piet de Visser]] and in July 2004, he was sold to [[PSV Eindhoven|PSV]].
===PSV=== Gomes made his debut for the [[Eindhoven]] club against Serbian side [[Red Star Belgrade]] on 11 August 2004.<ref>{{cite web |title=Meesterscout Piet de Visser |url=http://sargasso.nl/archief/2008/02/08/meesterscout-piet-de-visser/ |publisher=Sargasso |date=8 February 2008 |accessdate=15 June 2008 | language = Dutch}}</ref>
At first, there were critics, saying that Brazilians "should be on the field, not in the goal". In other words, there were doubts if Gomes was reliable enough. Those doubts were quickly erased. Even though he conceded two goals in his debut against [[RBC Roosendaal|RBC]], which PSV won 5–2, he proved himself to be a reliable goalkeeper. He played a major part in PSV's four latest consecutive titles in the Eredivisie and in the great European achievements. In his first season, PSV immediately reached the semi-finals of the [[2004–05 UEFA Champions League|UEFA Champions League]], where in the 14 attempts before, PSV wasn't able to reach the second round. In the following seasons, PSV progressed each time from the group stage.
In the [[Eredivisie]], Gomes was known for his outstanding reflexes, which saved points for PSV more than once. Also his trademark throwing ability is well known. Gomes is able to throw the ball all the way deep into the opponents half. Also before the start of the match and second half, Gomes jumps up above the goal with his shoulders, pumping up the PSV supporters.
Gomes was a crowd favorite at PSV. He can speak [[Portuguese language|Portuguese]] and [[Spanish language|Spanish]] and while in the Netherlands, he picked up a fair amount of [[Dutch language|Dutch]], although it has to be said he is not fluent in the language.
Even though the rivalry between PSV, [[Feyenoord]] and [[AFC Ajax|Ajax]] is intense, fans from rival clubs showed sympathy for the Brazilian.
Notable was an incident in [[Rotterdam]] in the match against Feyenoord, when Gomes injured himself whilst celebrating a goal, scored by his teammate [[Phillip Cocu]]. However, he managed to continue and even managed to pull off a wonder save, keeping his side in the game, which they went on to draw.
===Tottenham Hotspur=== Following the appointment of manager [[Juande Ramos]], Gomes signed for [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] on 27 June 2008<ref>{{cite news|title=Gomes deal agreed|url=http://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/news/articles/gomesdealagreed260608.html|work=Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|publisher=tottenhamhotspur.com|date=27 June 2008|accessdate=27 June 2008 }}</ref> for a fee was believed to be around £7.8 million.<ref>{{cite news |title=Tottenham pay £7m for Brazil goalkeeper Heurelho Gomes|url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/sport/football/premier_league/article4222568.ece|work=Times.|publisher=www.times online.co.uk|date=27 June 2008|accessdate=14 February 2010| location=London| first=Gary| last=Jacob}}</ref> Gomes played his first game in Tottenham colours in a pre-season [[exhibition game|friendly match]] on 19 July 2008 against Spanish [[Segunda División B]] side [[CD Dénia|Dénia]], which Tottenham won 4–2.
Gomes eventually obtained a [[Work permit (United Kingdom)|work permit]] to play in the United Kingdom, despite playing less than the 75% required number of games for [[Brazil national football team|Brazil]] in the last two years. Gomes made his home debut on 10 August 2008, keeping a [[Shutout#Association football|clean sheet]] with a 5–0 victory over [[A.S. Roma|Roma]] on Tottenham's last pre-season friendly, before the [[2008–09 Premier League]] began.
Tottenham lost their two opening games 2–1 to [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] and [[Sunderland F.C.|Sunderland]] respectively, but his presence in goal helped Spurs earn their first point of the season with a draw against [[Chelsea F.C.–Tottenham Hotspur F.C. rivalry|rival]] club [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] at [[Stamford Bridge (stadium)|Stamford Bridge]]. His reputation took a hit a week later, however, when he conceded a weak shot from [[Ashley Young]]<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/7601910.stm|title=Tottenham 1–2 Aston Villa|author=Chris Whyatt|publisher=British Broadcasting Corporation|work=BBC Sport|date=15 September 2008|accessdate=16 September 2008}}</ref> in Spurs' 2–1 home defeat against [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]]. These blunders continued as he conceded an [[own goal]] in a [[London derbies|London derby]] against [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] on 15 November 2008, which kept his club mired deep in the relegation zone and also caused Spurs goalkeeping coach [[Hans Leitert]] to be sacked on 19 November 2008, with the appointment of former Spurs goalkeeper [[Tony Parks]] made shortly after.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/t/tottenham_hotspur/7737001.stm|title=Spurs goalkeeping coach departs|publisher=British Broadcasting Corporation|work=BBC Sport|date=19 November 2008|accessdate=19 November 2008}}</ref>
Gomes went on to put in a strong performance against [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]], saving two shots deep into the match in which Tottenham won 2–0, before making two important saves to deny [[Park Ji-sung]] and [[Ryan Giggs]] in a 0–0 draw with [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/7763495.stm|title=Tottenham 0–0 Manchester United|publisher=British Broadcasting Corporation|work=BBC Sport|author=Ian Hughes|date=13 December 2008|accessdate=13 December 2008}}</ref>
Gomes was injured in Spurs' 5–1 win over [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] in the second game of the [[2009–10 Premier League]] season and had to be replaced by second-choice goalkeeper [[Carlo Cudicini]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/8202440.stm |title=Hull 1 – 5 Tottenham |publisher=British Broadcasting Corporation|work=BBC Sport |date=19 August 2009 |accessdate=22 August 2009|author=Sam Lyon }}</ref> After an [[MRI]] scan, it was revealed that Gomes suffered damage to his groin which would keep him out for up to a month.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/news/articles/gomesupdate200809.html |title=Gomes update. |work=Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|publisher=tottenhamhotspur.com |date=20 August 2009 |accessdate=22 August 2009 }}</ref> He made his return to first team action in the 5–1 victory over [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]] in the [[Football League Cup|League Cup]] on 23 September 2009,<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/news/articles/peterthegreat230909.html |title=Peter the great! |work=Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|publisher=tottenhamhotspur.com |date=23 September 2009 |accessdate=23 September 2009 }}</ref> and made his Premier League comeback in the 2–1 win at [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]] on 17 October. During this match, the Brazilian made a handful of brilliant saves, one of which was compared by former Spurs goalkeeper [[Pat Jennings]] to a famous save made by [[Gordon Banks]] against Brazil in the [[1970 FIFA World Cup]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/news/articles/gomesmiraclesavepat211009.html |title=Gomes' 'miracle save' – Pat. |work=Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|publisher=tottenhamhotspur.com |date=21 October 2009 |accessdate=22 October 2009 }}</ref>
[[File:Laurent Koscielny-cropped.jpg|thumb|upright|Gomes (in green) clashing with [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] defender [[Laurent Koscielny]] in a [[North London derby]] in November 2010]] On 3 April 2010, he made two [[penalty kick (association football)|penalty]] saves out of three against in a 3–1 defeat away at Sunderland, then on 14 April, Gomes' fine form aided Spurs in picking up their first Premier League victory over Arsenal in 21 meetings; he saved a [[Robin van Persie]] free kick and several other attempts on goal in succession. The following week, on 17 April, Gomes again made several crucial saves as Tottenham beat Chelsea 2–1 as the team passed [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] to sit fourth in the League standings. He kept a clean sheet in a 1–0 win over [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanders]] and then played a vital role in the 1–0 victory against Manchester City with two crucial saves which saw Tottenham get into the [[UEFA Champions League]] for the first time ever.
On 20 October 2010, Gomes received a [[ejection (sports)|red card]] for fouling [[Jonathan Biabiany]] within the first ten minutes of the first half against European Champions [[Inter Milan]] at the [[San Siro]] in [[2010–11 UEFA Champions League|the Champions League]]. Tottenham Hotspur lost the match 4–3 after going 4–0 down inside the first 35 minutes, despite a second half [[List of UEFA Champions League hat-tricks|hat-trick]] from [[Gareth Bale]].<ref>{{cite news|title= Inter Milan 4 Tottenham 3|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/europe/9102192.stm|publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=20 October 2010|date=20 October 2010}}</ref>
Gomes' goalkeeping ability was called into question on 13 April 2011 in the second leg tie against [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]] after a long-shot from [[Cristiano Ronaldo]] slipped out of Gomes' hands over his head and into the goal to put Real Madrid 5–0 up on aggregate. Gomes took blame for another controversial goal against Chelsea on 30 April after a shot from [[Frank Lampard]] slipped between his legs and although Gomes scrambled back and appeared to clear the ball, the goal was allowed.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/9469237.stm | work=BBC News | title=Chelsea 2–1 Tottenham | date=30 April 2011}}</ref> Spurs went on to lose the game 2–1.
After several high-profile errors and misjudgements by Gomes, Tottenham signed 40-year-old keeper [[Brad Friedel]] on a [[free transfer (association football)|free transfer]] from Aston Villa to provide competition in the first team. Friedel began the season as the starter with Gomes being relegated to the bench and later being left out of match day squads entirely, which led to immediate speculation regarding his future at the club.<ref>{{cite web|title=Harry ready to let Gomes go|url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,,11675_7171541,00.html|publisher=SkySports.com|accessdate=15 September 2011}}</ref> Gomes played his first match of the [[2011–12 Tottenham Hotspur F.C. season|2011–12 season]] in a [[2011–12 Football League Cup|League Cup]] defeat to [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]] 6–7 in a [[penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalty shoot-out]] after [[Massimo Luongo]] missed a penalty. Subsequently, Gomes played in the [[2011–12 UEFA Europa League]], keeping a clean sheet in the 1–0 victory over [[FC Rubin Kazan|Rubin Kazan]]. Following Spurs' deadline day capture of goalkeeper [[Hugo Lloris]] from [[Olympique Lyonnais|Lyon]], Gomes slipped to fourth-choice at Spurs, but following the sale of Carlo Cudicini to the [[LA Galaxy]], he rose back to third-choice, behind Lloris and Friedel.
====Loan to 1899 Hoffenheim==== On the final day of the January 2013 transfer window, Gomes agreed to join German [[Bundesliga]] side [[TSG 1899 Hoffenheim|1899 Hoffenheim]] on loan until the end of [[2012–13 Bundesliga|the season]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21275694 |title=Heurelho Gomes: Tottenham loan goalkeeper to Hoffenheim |work=BBC |publisher=BBC Sport |date=31 January 2013 |accessdate=31 January 2013 }}</ref> On 2 February, he made his debut as Hoffenheim won 2–1 against [[SC Freiburg]]. After the match, manager [[Marco Kurz]] praised Gomes, saying, "Gomes has shown a very solid performance. Although he has only trained once with us, his aura was strong." Throughout the match, Gomes made four crucial saves and looked assured in claiming six crosses, commanding his penalty area.<ref>{{cite news|title=Heurelho Gomes causes a stir on Hoffenheim debut|url=http://hereisthecity.com/2013/02/04/heurelho-gomes-causes-a-stir-on-hoffenheim-debut/|publisher=Here is the City|date=4 February 2013|accessdate=4 February 2013}}</ref> By his third match for Hoffenheim, he was already [[captain (association football)|captain]]ing the team, although his season ended prematurely when, on 6 April 2013, he broke his [[metacarpus]] during an important 3–0 home win over [[Fortuna Düsseldorf]]. He had to undergo hand surgery.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.achtzehn99.de/saisonende-fuer-heurelho-gomes/ |language = German | title=Saisonende für Heurelho Gomes|publisher=achtzehn99.de|date=6 April 2013|accessdate=11 April 2013}}</ref>
====Return to Tottenham==== After his injury, Gomes returned to Tottenham and started the [[2013–14 Tottenham Hotspur F.C. season|2013–14 season]] with Spurs. Gomes' role remained as third-choice, however, as the backup to Brad Friedel and the club number one Hugo Lloris. On 22 May 2014, Tottenham announced that Gomes would leave the club the following month when his contract expired.<ref>{{cite web|title=Heurelho Gomes to depart Tottenham |url=http://www.espnfc.com/news/story/_/id/1829876/heurelho-gomes-depart-tottenham?cc=5901 |work=[[ESPN]] |date=22 May 2014 |accessdate=23 May 2014}}</ref> [[File:Heurelho Gomes 150314 Watford v Reading-92.jpg|thumbnail|Gomes warming-up for Watford.]]
===Watford=== Gomes signed a one-year deal, with an option of a second, at [[Football League Championship|Championship]] side [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] on 24 May 2014.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.watfordfc.com/news/article/140524-heurelho-gomes-signs-for-watford-1571831.aspx |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2014-05-24 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140524101933/http://www.watfordfc.com/news/article/140524-heurelho-gomes-signs-for-watford-1571831.aspx |archivedate=24 May 2014 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> In his first season with the Championship club Gomes played in 44 games helping the club gain [[promotion and relegation|promotion]] to the Premier League.
Following the Hornets' promotion to the Premier League, Gomes signed a new three-year contract with the club on 20 May 2015.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.watfordfc.com/news/article/150520-heurelho-gomes-new-watford-fc-contract-2463252.aspx |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2015-05-20 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150520162420/http://www.watfordfc.com/news/article/150520-heurelho-gomes-new-watford-fc-contract-2463252.aspx |archivedate=20 May 2015 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> He won the Player of the Season award at the end of the 2015/16 season.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.watfordfc.com/teams/first-team/heurelho-gomes |title=Heurelho Gomes Profile}}</ref>
==International career== [[File:Heurelho Gomes.jpg|thumb|upright|Gomes in an international [[exhibition game|friendly]] against [[Wales national football team|Wales]] in 2006.]] Gomes made his debut for Brazil in the [[2003 CONCACAF Gold Cup]]. Although the competition is for senior national teams, Brazil chose to send an under-23 squad to the competition. Gomes made five appearances as Brazil went to the final and finished second after being beaten by [[Mexico national football team|Mexico]] 1–0.
Despite being part of the [[2005 FIFA Confederations Cup squads#Brazil|Brazilian squad]] that won the [[2005 FIFA Confederations Cup]] as the third-choice keeper behind [[Dida (footballer, born 1973)|Dida]] and [[Marcos Roberto Silveira Reis|Marcos]], Gomes did not receive any playing time. He was also excluded from then coach [[Carlos Alberto Parreira]]'s final [[2006 FIFA World Cup squads#Brazil|23-man roster]] for the [[2006 FIFA World Cup]] in Germany.
It was not until his inclusion in the team for a series of late-summer friendlies, as a consequence of new Brazil coach [[Dunga]]'s desire to play many of the ''Seleção's'' younger stars, that Gomes has finally gained some consistent playing time in goal. On 14 August 2006, he was called up for a friendly against [[Norway national football team|Norway]], which ended in a 1–1 draw. On 3 September 2006, he played in Brazil's 3–0 win over rivals [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]] at [[Emirates Stadium]] in England. Two days later, Gomes kept a second consecutive clean sheet in a 2–0 victory over [[Wales national football team|Wales]] at [[White Hart Lane]]. His latest stint between the sticks was during a 2–1 win over [[Ecuador national football team|Ecuador]] on 10 October 2006.
On 11 May 2010, it was announced that Gomes would be part of the [[2010 FIFA World Cup squads#Brazil|Brazilian squad]] which would compete at the [[2010 FIFA World Cup|2010 World Cup]] in South Africa, alongside [[Júlio César (football goalkeeper, born 1979)|Júlio César]] and [[Doni (footballer)|Doni]]. Gomes made a rare appearance for Brazil in a World Cup warm-up game, replacing Brazil's number one keeper Júlio César as a substitute.<ref>[http://www.irishtimes.com/sports/soccer/2010/0602/1224271732343.html? Julio Cesar injury mars Brazil victory] irishtimes.com 2 June 2010</ref>

'''Daryl Janmaat''' (born 22 July 1989) is a Dutch professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|right back]] for [[Premier League]] club [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] and the [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands national team]].
He began his career at [[ADO Den Haag]], and went on to play for the [[Eredivisie]] clubs [[SC Heerenveen|Heerenveen]] and [[Feyenoord]] before joining Newcastle on a six-year deal in 2014.
A full international since 2012, Janmaat has earned over 20 caps and was part of the Dutch team which finished third at the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]].
==Club career== ===ADO Den Haag=== Born in [[Leidschendam]], [[South Holland]], Janmaat started his senior career in [[2007–08 Eerste Divisie|2007–08]], with [[ADO Den Haag]] in the [[Eerste Divisie]].
===Heerenveen=== In the following off-season the 19-year-old moved straight into the [[Eredivisie]], signing for [[SC Heerenveen]]. In Heerenveen's [[2009-10 UEFA Europa League|Europa League]] match against [[Hertha Berlin]] on 23 October 2009, Janmaat came on as a 73rd-minute substitute for Norwegian [[Christian Grindheim]] and received a red card three minutes later for a late challenge on [[Nemanja Pejčinović]] but Heerenveen held on for a 1–0 victory.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2010/matches/round=2000037/match=2000818/postmatch/report/index.html |title=Heerenveen leave Hertha hurting |publisher=UEFA |date=23 October 2009 |accessdate=16 July 2014 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2009/10/22/europe/uefa-cup/hertha-bsc-berlin/sportclub-heerenveen/858309/ |title=Hertha BSC 0–1 Heerenveen |publisher=Soccerway |date=23 October 2009 |accessdate=16 July 2014 }}</ref> After serving a required suspension, Janmaat scored in his next Europa League appearance on 16 December 2009, netting his side's final goal in a 5–0 win over [[FK Ventspils]] at the [[Abe Lenstra Stadion]] in Heerenveen but the win proved insufficient as Heerenveen failed to qualify for the knockout stages.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2010/matches/round=2000037/match=2000902/postmatch/report/index.html |title=Hollow victory for Heerenveen |publisher=UEFA |date=16 December 2009 |accessdate=16 July 2014 }}</ref>
On 21 December 2011, Janmaat scored Heerenveen's ninth goal in an 11–1 thrashing of [[2011–12 Eerste Divisie|Eerste Divisie]] side [[FC Oss]] to reach the quarter-finals of the [[2011–12 KNVB Cup|KNVB Beker]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/news/2557/news/2011/12/23/2814989/knvb-beker-results-psv-eliminate-twente-to-join-as |title=KNVB Beker Results: PSV eliminate Twente to join as Heerenveen score 11 to reach quarter-finals |publisher=Goal.com |date=23 December 2011 |accessdate=17 July 2014 }}</ref> During his four seasons with the club Janmaat was a starter in three after appearing in only ten games in [[2008–09 Eredivisie|his debut campaign]], which ended with [[2008–09 KNVB Cup|conquest]] of the [[KNVB Cup|Dutch Cup]].
===Feyenoord=== In the middle of 2012, after his contract expired, he signed for fellow top-division side [[Feyenoord]], which he had already represented as a youth.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en-au/news/4016/main/2012/02/01/2879584/official-feyenoord-to-sign-heerenveens-daryl-janmaat-this |title=Official: Feyenoord to sign Heerenveen's Daryl Janmaat this summer |publisher=Goal.com |date=1 February 2012 |accessdate=16 June 2014 }}</ref> Janmaat picked up two yellow cards in the space of one minute and was sent off on 9 December 2012 as Feyenoord drew with [[NAC Breda]] 2–2 in [[2012-13 Eredivisie|league]] play.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2012/12/09/netherlands/eredivisie/nac-bv/feyenoord-rotterdam-nv/1290559/ |title=NAC Breda 2–2 Feyenoord |publisher=Soccerway |date=9 December 2012 |accessdate=16 July 2014 }}</ref> On 17 March 2013, he scored the winning goal for Feyenoord as they defeated [[FC Utrecht]] 2–1.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/dutch-eredivisie/11/video/1379030/highlights-feyenoord-2-1-utrecht |title=Highlights: Feyenoord 2–1 Utrecht |publisher=ESPNFC |date=17 March 2013 |accessdate=16 July 2014 }}</ref>
Janmaat scored his first goal of the [[2013–14 Eredivisie]] season on 16 February 2014, converting a pass from [[Graziano Pellè]] as Feyenoord drew 1–1 with NAC Breda.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.voetbaluitslagen.nl/eredivisie/2013-2014/regulier-seizoen/speelweek-24/nac-breda-feyenoord-1478544/ |title=NAC Breda 1–1 Feyenoord |publisher=Voetbal Uitslagen |date=16 February 2014 |accessdate=16 July 2014 |language=Dutch }}</ref> On 13 April, he scored on the half-volley in the 76th minute as Feyenoord defeated [[PSV Eindhoven|PSV]] 2–0 in league play.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/video/football/video-1096256/Newcastle-target-Janmaat-scores-great-goal-Feyenoord.html |title=Newcastle target Janmaat scores great goal for Feyenoord |publisher=Daily Mail |accessdate=16 July 2014 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://foxsports.nl/video/206856-76-doelpunt-daryl-janmaat-psv-feyenoord-0-2.html |title=76' DOELPUNT DARYL JANMAAT, PSV – FEYENOORD, 0–2 |publisher=Fox Sports Netherlands |date=13 April 2014 |accessdate=16 July 2014 |language=Dutch }}</ref>
===Newcastle United=== On 17 July 2014, Janmaat joined [[Premier League]] club [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] on a six-year deal for an undisclosed fee.<ref>{{cite web|last=Marshall|first=Anthony|url=http://www.nufc.co.uk/articles/20140717/newcastle-secure-janmaat-signing_2281670_4000291 |title=Newcastle Secure Janmaat Signing |publisher=Newcastle United F.C.|date=17 July 2014 |accessdate=17 July 2014 }}</ref> He made his competitive debut on 17 August, playing the full 90 minutes as Newcastle began their league campaign with a 2–0 home defeat to [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Newcastle 0–2 Man City|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28730044|accessdate=17 August 2014|publisher=BBC Sport|date=17 August 2014}}</ref> On 30 August, Janmaat scored his first goal for the club in a 3–3 draw against [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/28906780|title=Newcastle United 3–3 Crystal Palace|publisher=BBC Sport|date=30 August 2014|accessdate=23 September 2017}}</ref> Over the course of the season, he assisted goals in matches against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]],<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/29868777|title=West Bromwich Albion 0–3 Newcastle United 3–3 Crystal Palace|publisher=BBC Sport|date=9 November 2014|accessdate=23 September 2017}}</ref> [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]],<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/30600747|title=Newcastle United 3–3 Burnley|publisher=BBC Sport|date=1 January 2015|accessdate=23 September 2017}}</ref> Crystal Palace<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/31124658|title=Crystal Palace 1–1 Newcastle United|publisher=BBC Sport|date=11 February 2015|accessdate=23 September 2017}}</ref> and [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/31562897|title=Newcastle United 1–0 Aston Villa|publisher=BBC Sport|date=28 February 2015|accessdate=23 September 2017}}</ref> For his defensive performances, he was announced as Player of the Year by the [[Newcastle United Supporters Trust]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.true-faith.co.uk/newcastle-united-supporters-trust-and-the-2015-player-of-the-season-is|title=NEWCASTLE UNITED SUPPORTERS TRUST – And the 2015 Player of the Season is ...|magazine=True Faith|date=31 May 2015|accessdate=23 September 2017}}</ref>
On 15 August 2015, Janmaat was sent off for two bookable offences against [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]], and was therefore unavailable for the following match against [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/33832172|title=Swansea City 2–0 Newcastle United|publisher=BBC Sport|date=28 February 2015|accessdate=23 September 2017}}</ref> On 25 August, and in the second round Football League Cup tie against [[Northampton Town F.C.|Northampton Town]], he scored the third goal in a 4–1 win.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/33970053|title=Newcastle United 4–1 Northampton Town|publisher=BBC Sport|date=25 August 2015|accessdate=23 September 2017}}</ref> On 19 September, he scored the consolation goal in a 2–1 loss to [[Watford F.C.|Watford]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/34191888|title=Newcastle United 1–2 Watford|publisher=BBC Sport|date=19 September 2015|accessdate=23 September 2017}}</ref> On 23 September, he was named captain for the third round League Cup tie against [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]], but was taken off at half-time, citing illness.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/newcastle-vs-sheff-wed/351317|title=Newcastle 0–1 Sheffield Wednesday: Pressure builds on Steve McClaren|publisher=Sky Sports|date=23 September 2015|accessdate=23 September 2017}}</ref> He later assisted goals in matches against [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]],<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/34498802|title=Newcastle United 6–2 Norwich City|publisher=BBC Sport|date=18 October 2015|accessdate=23 September 2017}}</ref> Crystal Palace<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/34887485|title=Crystal Palace 5–1 Newcastle United|publisher=BBC Sport|date=28 November 2015|accessdate=23 September 2017}}</ref> and [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35270693|title=Newcastle United 2–1 West Ham United|publisher=BBC Sport|date=16 January 2016|accessdate=23 September 2017}}</ref>
On 2 March 2016, and after a 1–0 loss away to [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]], he was involved in a confrontation with Newcastle supporters. Intending to applaud the travelling supporters, but met with anger instead; he had to be turned away by [[Jamaal Lascelles]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/daryl-janmaat-angry-confrontation-newcastle-7485443|title=Daryl Janmaat in angry confrontation with Newcastle supporters after defeat to Stoke|work=Daily Mirror|first=Liam|last=Prendergast|date=3 March 2015|accessdate=23 September 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/newcastles-daryl-janmaat-did-not-7496637|title=Newcastle's Daryl Janmaat 'did not want to get in a confrontation' with fuming fans after Stoke loss|work=Daily Mirror|first=Simon|last=Bird|date=4 March 2015|accessdate=23 September 2017}}</ref> On 9 April, Janmaat was substituted in the first half of a 3–1 loss away to [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]], having sustained a groin injury. In his frustration, he punched a wall and broke two of his fingers, missing the next four matches for Newcastle.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35270693|title=Southampton 3–1 Newcastle United|publisher=BBC Sport|date=9 April 2016|accessdate=23 September 2017}}</ref> [[Vurnon Anita]] replaced him in his absence, and as a result, reports linked him away from the club. He returned to the squad for the penultimate match of the season against Aston Villa, but was not brought on.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36176563|title=Aston Villa 0–0 Newcastle United|publisher=BBC Sport|date=7 May 2016|accessdate=23 September 2017}}</ref> He was named in the final match of the season against [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]]. By this time, the club were already relegated, but managed to beat Tottenham 5–1, with Janmaat assisting the fourth goal and scoring the fifth goal.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36240333|title=Newcastle United 5–1 Tottenham Hotspur|publisher=Tottenham Hotspur|date=15 May 2016|accessdate=23 September 2017}}</ref> A picture of a Newcastle supporter giving Janmaat a [[V sign#As an insult|reversed two-fingered salute]], as the Dutchman wheeled away celebrating his goal was widely circulated on social media.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/phuqewe/status/731904154545741824|title=Mark on Twitter: This fella casually flipping V’s is my new hero. #NUFC|website=Twitter|date=15 May 2016|accessdate=23 September 2017}}</ref>
===Watford=== On 24 August 2016, following Newcastle's relegation to the Championship, Janmaat signed for Premier League [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] for a fee of £7.5 million.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.watfordfc.com/teams/first-team/janmaat-joins-hornets|title=Janmaat joins the Hornets|date=2016-08-24|website=watfordfc.com|language=en-GB|access-date=2016-08-24}}</ref>
==International career== Janmaat made his debut for the [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands]] on 7 September 2012, playing the full 90 minutes in a 2–0 home win against [[Turkey national football team|Turkey]] for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualification – UEFA Group D|qualifiers]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.vi.nl/nieuws/227479/Martins-Indi-en-Janmaat-niet-foutloos-Had-beter-gekund.htm |title=Martins Indi en Janmaat niet foutloos: 'Had beter gekund' |trans-title=Martins Indi and Janmaat not perfect: 'Could have played better' |publisher=[[Voetbal International]] |date=8 September 2012 |accessdate=8 March 2014 |archivedate=November 12, 2012 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121112124954/http://www.vi.nl/nieuws/227479/Martins-Indi-en-Janmaat-niet-foutloos-Had-beter-gekund.htm |deadurl=yes |df=mdy }}</ref> On 31 May 2014, he was selected by national team manager [[Louis van Gaal]] to the final 23-man squad for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup|World Cup]] in Brazil.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/world-cup-2014/holland-world-cup-squad-louis-3629940 |title=Holland World Cup squad: Louis van Gaal wields the axe to select final 23 for Brazil |publisher=Mirror |date=31 May 2014 |accessdate=17 July 2014 }}</ref> He played his first game in the tournament on 13 June, providing an assist, as Holland thrashed defending champions [[Spain national football team|Spain]] 5–1.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/news/y=2014/m=6/news=rvp-robben-inspire-incredible-spanish-thrashing-2369652.html |title=RVP, Robben inspire incredible Spanish thrashing |publisher=FIFA.com |date=13 June 2014 |accessdate=18 June 2014 |archivedate=July 10, 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140710000201/http://www.fifa.com/worldcup/news/y%3D2014/m%3D6/news%3Drvp-robben-inspire-incredible-spanish-thrashing-2369652.html |deadurl=yes |df=mdy }}</ref> In the third-place playoff match against host nation [[Brazil national football team|Brazil]], Janmaat came on as a late substitute for [[Daley Blind]] and provided the assist for [[Georginio Wijnaldum]] as Holland won 3–0.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://sports.yahoo.com/news/netherlands-leads-host-brazil-2-204942812--sow.html |title=Netherlands beats host Brazil 3–0 to finish 3rd |publisher=Yahoo Sports |date=12 July 2014 |accessdate=17 July 2014 }}</ref>

{{Spanish name|Britos|Cabrera}} {{Use dmy dates|date=July 2013}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Miguel Britos | image = Miguel angel britos.JPG | image_size = 250 | caption = Britos in 2011 | fullname = Miguel Ángel Britos Cabrera<ref>{{cite web |title=Squads for 2016/17 Premier League confirmed |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/84136 |publisher=Premier League |date=1 September 2016 |accessdate=11 September 2016}}</ref> | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1985|7|17|df=y}}<ref name="Premier League">{{cite web |url=http://www.premierleague.com/en-gb/players/profile.overview.html/miguel-britos |title=Premier League Player Profile Miguel Britos |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=2016 |publisher=Barclays Premier League |access-date=7 February 2016}}</ref> | birth_place = [[Maldonado, Uruguay|Maldonado]], Uruguay | height = {{height|m=1.88|precision=0}}<ref name="Premier League"/> | currentclub = [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] | clubnumber = 3 | position = [[Defender (association football)#Centre-back|Centre back]] | youthyears1 = | youthclubs1 = | years1 = 2005–2006 | clubs1 = [[Centro Atlético Fénix|Fénix]] | caps1 = 12 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2006–2007 | clubs2 = [[Juventud de Las Piedras|Juventud]] | caps2 = 33 | goals2 = 3 | years3 = 2007–2008 | clubs3 = [[Montevideo Wanderers F.C.|Montevideo Wanderers]] | caps3 = 26 | goals3 = 1 | years4 = 2008–2011 | clubs4 = [[Bologna F.C. 1909|Bologna]] | caps4 = 71 | goals4 = 4 | years5 = 2011–2015 | clubs5 = [[S.S.C. Napoli|Napoli]] | caps5 = 68 | goals5 = 3 | years6 = 2015– | clubs6 = [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] | caps6 = 64 | goals6 = 2 | pcupdate = 19:04, 19 January 2019 (UTC) | ntupdate = }} '''Miguel Ángel Britos Cabrera''' ({{IPA-es|miˈɣel ˈβɾitos}};{{efn|In isolation, ''Britos'' is pronounced {{IPA-es|ˈbɾitos|}}.}} born 17 July 1985) is a [[Uruguay]]an [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association football)#Centre-back|centre back]] for [[Premier League]] team [[Watford F.C.|Watford]].
==Club career==
===Fénix=== Britos began his professional career playing with [[Centro Atlético Fénix|Fénix]] in 2005. After playing the [[2005–06 Uruguayan Primera División]] season, his team was relegated to the [[Uruguayan Segunda División]]. {{citation needed|date=May 2015}}
===Juventud=== On 1 July 2006, Britos was transferred to [[Juventud de Las Piedras]], where he achieved the promotion to the [[2007–08 Uruguayan Primera División|2007–08 Uruguayan Top Division season]].
===Wanderers=== On 1 July 2007, Britos signed a new contract with [[Montevideo Wanderers F.C.|Montevideo Wanderers]].
===Bologna=== Britos then moved to Italy on 22 July 2008 where he played for [[Bologna F.C. 1909|Bologna]] in the [[Serie A]], signing a five-year contract for a €2 million transfer fee.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.espectador.com/1v4_contenido.php?id=126807&sts=1 |publisher=Espectador.com |title=Seis millones de dólares |trans-title=Six million dollars |accessdate=12 July 2008 |date=12 July 2008 |language=Spanish |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120407030905/http://www.espectador.com/1v4_contenido.php?id=126807&sts=1 |archivedate=7 April 2012 |df=dmy-all }}</ref><ref>Bologna FC 1909 SpA ''bilancio'' (financial report and accounts) on 30 June 2009, [http://www.registroimprese.it PDF purchased from Italian C.C.I.A.A.] {{it icon}}</ref> He made his Serie A debut on 21 September 2008 against [[ACF Fiorentina|Fiorentina]]. On 21 February 2009, he scored his first Serie A goal against [[Inter Milan|Inter]].
===Napoli=== Britos' talent did not go unnoticed, and he was subsequently purchased from Bologna by [[S.S.C. Napoli|Napoli]] on 12 July 2011 in a €9 million transfer deal, signing a four-year contract.<ref>Bologna FC 1909 SpA ''bilancio'' (financial report and accounts) on 30 June 2012, [http://www.registroimprese.it PDF purchased from Italian C.C.I.A.A.] {{it icon}}</ref><ref>SSC Napoli SpA ''bilancio'' (financial report and accounts) on 30 June 2012, [http://www.registroimprese.it PDF purchased from Italian C.C.I.A.A.] {{it icon}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.sscnapoli.it/client/render.aspx?root=707&fwd=4155&content=0|title=Britos: Ho sempre sognato Napoli|trans-title=Britos: I always dreams for Napoli|date=12 July 2011|accessdate=3 May 2015|publisher=SSC Napoli|language=Italian| archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20110716064849/http://www.sscnapoli.it/client/render.aspx?root=707&fwd=4155&content=0| archivedate = 16 July 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/11/transfer-zone/2011/07/12/2571826/official-miguel-britos-completes-switch-to-napoli |publisher=Goal.com |title=Official: Miguel Britos completes switch to Napoli |accessdate=12 July 2011 |date=12 July 2011}}</ref> He scored his first goal for Napoli in a 2–0 home win over [[A.C. Chievo Verona|Chievo]] on 13 February 2012.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.goal.com/en/match/64069/ssc-napoli-vs-chievo/report |publisher=Goal.com |title=Napoli 2–0 Chievo: Britos and Cavani strike as Walter Mazzarri's side record first Serie A win in six matches |accessdate=13 February 2012 |date=13 February 2012}}</ref> Growing into an invaluable asset for [[Walter Mazzarri]]'s side, Britos featured in the [[2012 Coppa Italia Final|final]] of the [[Coppa Italia]] on 20 May 2012, as Napoli defeated Serie A champions [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]] 2–0.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.legaseriea.it/it/serie-a-tim/match-report/-/match-report/Juventus-Napoli/37894 |title=JUVENTUS – NAPOLI – 0 2 |publisher=Serie A TIM |date=20 May 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140903073821/http://www.legaseriea.it/it/serie-a-tim/match-report/-/match-report/Juventus-Napoli/37894 |archivedate=3 September 2014 |df= }}</ref>
On 23 May 2015, he headbutted [[Álvaro Morata]] in a 3–1 away defeat to Juventus, and was sent off.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3094269/Juventus-3-1-Napoli-Roberto-Pereyra-Stefano-Sturaro-strike-Gianluigi-Buffon-saves-second-half-penalty-ensure-Rafa-Benitez-s-miss-Champions-League-qualification.html|title=Juventus 3–1 Napoli: Miguel Angel Britos sent off for brutal late headbutt on Alvaro Morata as Massimiliano Allegri's side march on|publisher=The Daily Mail|author1=Matt Barlow|accessdate=31 May 2015|date=23 May 2015}}</ref>
===Watford=== On 22 July 2015, Britos joined newly promoted English side [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] on a three-year deal.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Watford Sign Miguel Britos |url=http://www.watfordfc.com/news/article/150721-miguel-britos-signs-for-watford-fc-from-napoli-2561465.aspx |publisher=Watford FC |date=22 July 2015}}</ref> He was sent off on his debut against [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]] in the [[Football League Cup|League Cup]] on 25 August 2015.<ref>{{cite news|title=Preston 1–0 Watford|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33969908|accessdate=25 August 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=25 August 2015}}</ref>
His contract with Watford was extended at the end of the 2017–18 season, running until June 2019, after the club exercised an option.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44323459|title=Watford exercise one year option on Miguel Britos|date=31 May 2018|accessdate=2 June 2018|publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref>
==Club statistics== {{updated| match played 15 February 2019}}<ref>{{cite web|title=M. BRITOS|url=https://int.soccerway.com/players/miguel-angel-britos/23349/|website=Soccerway|accessdate=20 January 2019}}</ref>

{{Use dmy dates|date=September 2017}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Sebastian Prödl | image = AUT vs. LIE 2015-10-12 (135).jpg | caption = Prödl with [[Austria national football team|Austria]] in 2015 | fullname = Sebastian Prödl<ref>{{cite web |title=Squads for 2016/17 Premier League confirmed |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/84136 |publisher=Premier League |date=1 September 2016 |accessdate=11 September 2016}}</ref> | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1987|6|21|df=y}}<ref name="Premier League">{{cite web |url=http://www.premierleague.com/en-gb/players/profile.overview.html/sebastian-prodl |title=Premier League Player Profile Sebastian Prödl |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |year=2016 |publisher=Barclays Premier League |access-date=7 February 2016}}</ref> | birth_place = [[Graz]], Austria | height = 1.94m<ref name="Premier League"/> | position = [[Defender (association football)|Defender]] | currentclub = [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] | clubnumber = 5 | youthyears1 = 1993–1997 | youthclubs1 = SV Kirchberg | youthyears2 = 1997–2002 | youthclubs2 = SV Feldbach | youthyears3 = 2002–2006 | youthclubs3 = [[SK Sturm Graz|Sturm Graz]] | years1 = 2006–2008 | clubs1 = [[SK Sturm Graz|Sturm Graz]] | caps1 = 43 | goals1 = 4 | years2 = 2008–2015 | clubs2 = [[SV Werder Bremen|Werder Bremen]] | caps2 = 149 | goals2 = 10 | years3 = 2010 | clubs3 = [[SV Werder Bremen II|Werder Bremen II]] | caps3 = 1 | goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2015– | clubs4 = [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] | caps4 = 76 | goals4 = 3 | nationalyears1 = | nationalteam1 = [[Austria national under-19 football team|Austria U19]] | nationalcaps1 = 5 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = | nationalteam2 = [[Austria national under-20 football team|Austria U20]] | nationalcaps2 = 8 | nationalgoals2 = 1 | nationalyears3 = 2007– | nationalteam3 = [[Austria national football team|Austria]] | nationalcaps3 = 73 | nationalgoals3 = 4 | pcupdate = 08:20, 26 February 2019 (UTC) | ntupdate = 16 October 2018 }} '''Sebastian Prödl''' (born 21 June 1987) is an Austrian professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association football)|defender]] for [[Premier League]] club [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] and the [[Austria national football team|Austrian national team]]. A full international since 2007, he represented his nation at [[Euro 2008]].
Having started his career at [[SK Sturm Graz|Sturm Graz]] in 2006 he moved to Germany two years later where he played for [[SV Werder Bremen|Werder Bremen]] until 2015.
==Club career==
===Sturm Graz=== Aged 19, Prödl began his professional career playing for [[SK Sturm Graz|Sturm Graz]] in the [[Austrian Football Bundesliga|Austrian Bundesliga]] making his debut on 9 December 2006 in a 3–0 loss against [[SV Mattersburg]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Dank Schutti-Goldtor überwintert SVM auf Rang zwei |url=http://www.web.svm-fan.net/index.php?m=54&id=405 |publisher=SV Mattersburg Official Website |language=German |date=12 December 2006 |accessdate=3 October 2016}}</ref><ref name="Prodl2"/> He scored his first Sturm Graz goal against [[SC Rheindorf Altach|Rheindorf Altach]] on 9 May 2007 in a 1–0 win.<ref>{{cite news |title=Seit zehn Spielen auswärts ohne Sieg |url=http://www.vol.at/seit-zehn-spielen-auswaerts-ohne-sieg/news-20070509-10170465 |publisher=Vorarlberg Online |language=German |date=9 May 2007 |accessdate=4 October 2016}}</ref> Prödl went on to make sixteen appearances and scoring once in his first season.
Prödl soon established himself in the first team at Sturm Graz and despite the international commitment<ref name="Prodl2">{{cite news |title=Sturm-Spieler Sebastian Prödl übernimmt Verantwortung: Kapitän und Führungsspieler |url=http://www.news.at/a/sturm-spieler-sebastian-proedl-verantwortung-kapitaen-fuehrungsspieler-178242 |publisher=News.at |language=German |date=13 July 2007 |accessdate=4 October 2016}}</ref> and injury,<ref>{{cite news |title=Der größte Talenteschuppen steht in Graz |url=http://diepresse.com/home/sport/mehrsport/345592/Der-grosste-Talenteschuppen-steht-in-Graz?from=suche.intern.portal |publisher=Die Presse |language=German |date=25 November 2007 |accessdate=4 October 2016}}</ref> He went on to score three goals in 27 appearances against SV Mattersburg, [[FC Red Bull Salzburg|Red Bull Salzburg]]<ref>{{cite news |title=Fußball-Bundesliga: Sturm Graz ist Winterkönig |url=http://diepresse.com/home/sport/fussball/349369/FussballBundesliga_Sturm-Graz-ist-Winterkonig?from=suche.intern.portal |publisher=Die Presse |language=German |date=16 December 2007 |accessdate=4 October 2016}}</ref> and [[SK Austria Kärnten|Austria Kärnten]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Fußball-Bundesliga: Die Zeit des Umbruchs |url=http://diepresse.com/home/sport/fussball/379956/FussballwbrBundesliga_Die-Zeit-des-Umbruchs?from=suche.intern.portal |publisher=Die Presse |language=German |date=27 April 2008 |accessdate=4 October 2016}}</ref> His performances soon attracted attention from [[Serie A]] and [[Bundesliga]] clubs.<ref>{{cite news |title=Udinese-Milan-Fiorentina: sfuma Prödl |url=http://www.tuttomercatoweb.com/serie-a/udinese-milan-fiorentina-sfuma-prodl-89683 |publisher=Tutto Mercato Web |language=Italian |date=28 January 2008 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> In response to the transfer speculation Sturm Graz placed a price tag of €5 million on him.<ref>{{cite news |title=Graz will fünf Millionen Euro |url=http://www.bild.de/sport/bundesliga/absage-2302572.bild.html |work=Bild |language=German |date=12 August 2007 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref>
===Werder Bremen=== [[File:Sebastian Prödl.jpg|thumb|left|175px|Prödl in training during his time at [[SV Werder Bremen|Werder Bremen]]]]
On 15 July 2008, Prödl moved to Germany to play for [[SV Werder Bremen|Werder Bremen]] for a transfer fee of €2.5 million, signing a contract until 2012.<ref>{{cite news |title=Neuzugang Prödl gibt sich realistisch |url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/bundesliga/startseite/210690/artikel_neuzugang-proedl-gibt-sich-realistisch.html |publisher=Kicker.de |language=German |date=30 June 2008 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> Upon joining Werder Bremen, he said his aim at the club was to win trophies.<ref>{{cite news |title=Bremens Neuzugang Prödl will den Titel |url=http://www.n24.de/n24/Sport/Fussball/1-bundesliga/d/475782/bremens-neuzugang-proedl-will-den-titel.html |publisher=N24.de |language=German |date=8 July 2008 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref>
Prödl made his Werder Bremen debut in the first round of the [[DFB-Pokal]] in a 9–3 win over [[Eintracht Nordhorn]] on 9 August 2008. A week later, he made his league debut for the club, in a 2–2 draw against [[Arminia Bielefeld]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Bielefeld trotzt Bremen Remis ab |url=http://www.n24.de/n24/Sport/Fussball/1-bundesliga/d/509438/bielefeld-trotzt-bremen-remis-ab.html |publisher=N24.de |language=German |date=16 August 2008 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> He made his Champions League debut, playing as a right-back, in a 1–1 draw against [[Inter Milan]] on 1 October 2008.<ref>{{cite news |title=Pizarro staubt ab – Werder feiert Punkt |url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/chleague/spielrunde/champions-league/2008-09/2/883254/spielanalyse_inter-mailand_werder-bremen-4.html |publisher=Kicker.de |language=German |date=1 October 2008 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> By the first half of the season, he had appeared in 13 of 17 league matches, also playing in the unfamiliar right-back role in absence of [[Clemens Fritz]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Werder-Fans wechseln Prödl aus |url=http://www.bild.de/sport/fussball/bremen-fans-wechseln-verteidiger-aus-6495196.bild.html |work=Bild |language=German |date=17 November 2008 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> In the last match of the first half of the season he injured his ankle which saw him out for two months.<ref>{{cite news |title=Prödl: Wellness statt Skifahren |url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/bundesliga/startseite/501816/artikel_proedl_wellness-statt-skifahren.html |publisher=Kicker.de |language=German |date=15 August 2008 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> On 7 March 2009, after making the bench in three matches, Prödl returned to the first team in a 0–0 draw against [[TSG 1899 Hoffenheim|Hoffenheim]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Ohne Frings, Özil und Fritz – Grünes Licht für Wiese |url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/bundesliga/startseite/505472/artikel_ohne-frings-oezil-und-fritz---gruenes-licht-fuer-wiese.html |publisher=Kicker.de |language=German |date=7 March 2009 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> He scored his first Werder Bremen goal in the second leg of the last 16 of the [[UEFA Europa League|UEFA Cup]] in a 2–2 draw against [[AS Saint-Étienne|Saint-Étienne]], from which the club progressed winning 3–2 on aggregate.<ref>{{cite news |title=Prödl und Pizarro mit Köpfchen |url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/uefa/spielrunde/europa-league/2008-09/8/889322/spielanalyse_as-st-etienne_werder-bremen-4.html |publisher=Kicker.de |language=German |date=18 March 2009 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> Upon his return he reverted to centre-back going on to make a total of 22 appearances in his first season. Prödl formed a partnership with [[Naldo (footballer, born 1982)|Naldo]] in central defence when they beat [[Bayer 04 Leverkusen|Bayer Leverkusen]] 1–0 in the [[2009 DFB-Pokal Final|DFB-Pokal Final]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Werders Triumph dank Özil |url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/dfbpokal/spielrunde/dfb-pokal/2008-09/6/865823/spielanalyse_bayer-leverkusen-9_werder-bremen-4.html |publisher=Kicker.de |language=German |date=30 May 2009 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> He also featured in the [[2009 UEFA Cup Final|UEFA Cup final]], playing the full 120 minutes in a 3–2 loss against [[FC Shakhtar Donetsk|Shakhtar Donetsk]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Jádson the difference as Shakhtar triumph |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2009/matches/round=15290/match=302827/postmatch/report/index.html |publisher=UEFA Official Website |language=German |date=20 May 2009 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref>
[[File:Sebastian Proedl 2014-10-24.jpg|thumb|right|190px|Prödl in his last season at [[SV Werder Bremen|Werder Bremen]]]]
In the opening game of the 2009–10 season, Prödl played as a centre-back in a 3–2 loss against [[Eintracht Frankfurt]] and was sent-off in the last minutes after a second bookable offence.<ref>{{cite news |title=Amanatidis trifft und geht |url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/bundesliga/spieltag/1-bundesliga/2009-10/1/938006/spielanalyse_werder-bremen-4_eintracht-frankfurt-32.html |publisher=Kicker.de |language=German |date=8 August 2009 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> Soon after, he suffered a knee injury.<ref>{{cite news |title=Prödl operiert, Almeida in Gips |url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/bundesliga/startseite/513594/artikel_proedl-operiert-almeida-in-gips.html |publisher=Kicker.de |language=German |date=24 August 2009 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> After three months on the sidelines, he appeared on the substitution bench and made his return to the first team coming on for Naldo in the 76th minutes of a 6–0 win over [[SC Freiburg|Freiburg]] on 21 November 2009.<ref>{{cite news |title=Rosenberg macht das halbe Dutzend voll |url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/bundesliga/spieltag/1-bundesliga/2009-10/13/938146/spielanalyse_sc-freiburg-7_werder-bremen-4.html |publisher=Kicker.de |language=German |date=21 November 2009 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> He scored his first Werder Bremen league goal on 27 February 2010, in a 2–1 win over [[1. FSV Mainz 05|Mainz 05]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Prödl macht seinen Fehler wieder wett |url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/bundesliga/spieltag/1-bundesliga/2009-10/24/938241/spielanalyse_1-fsv-mainz-05-30_werder-bremen-4.html |publisher=Kicker.de |language=German |date=27 February 2010 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> Prödl spent most of the season on the substitution bench making nine appearances for the club.
In the 2010–11 season, Prödl became a regular starter following Naldo's injury at the start of the season and formed a partnership in central defence with [[Per Mertesacker]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Naldo fehlt noch länger |url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/dfbpokal/startseite/540957/artikel_naldo-fehlt-noch-laenger.html |publisher=Kicker.de |language=German |date=16 August 2010 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> He scored his first European goal on matchday 6 of the [[UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] group stage in a 3–0 win over Inter Milan on 7 December 2010.<ref>{{cite news |title=Schaaf-Schützlinge bestrafen lustloses Inter |url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/chleague/spielrunde/champions-league/2010-11/6/1120031/spielanalyse_werder-bremen-4_inter-mailand.html#omsearchresult |publisher=Kicker.de |language=German |date=7 December 2010 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> He scored his first league goal of the season on 27 February 2011 in a 2–2 draw against Bayer Leverkusen.<ref>{{cite news |title=Adler: "Das kotzt mich an" |url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/bundesliga/startseite/549195/artikel_adler_das-kotzt-mich-an.html |publisher=Kicker.de |language=German |date=27 February 2011 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> Having suffered a knee injury and undergone surgery it was announced in March 2011 that Prödl would miss the remainder of the 2010–11 season. He ended season with 25 appearances.<ref>{{cite news |title=Prödl kehrt in dieser Saison nicht zurück |url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/bundesliga/startseite/550344/artikel_proedl-kehrt-in-dieser-saison-nicht-zurueck.html |publisher=Kicker.de |language=German |date=26 March 2011 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref>
[[File:Sebastian Prödl 8849.JPG|thumb|left|180px|Prödl on international duty]]
At the start of the 2011–12 season, Prödl remained a regular starter. He scored his first goal of the season in a 3–1 win over Mainz on 29 October 2011.<ref>{{cite news |title=Pizarro macht's zum 150. Mal |url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/bundesliga/spieltag/1-bundesliga/2011-12/11/1143380/spielanalyse_1-fsv-mainz-05-30_werder-bremen-4.html |publisher=Kicker.de |language=German |date=29 October 2011 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> On 21 January 2012, during a match against [[1. FC Kaiserslautern|Kaiserslautern]], he was substituted off with an injury in the 29th minute.<ref>{{cite news |title=Pfosten und Latte retten Werder |url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/bundesliga/spieltag/1-bundesliga/2011-12/18/1143445/spielanalyse_1-fc-kaiserslautern-37_werder-bremen-4.html |publisher=Kicker.de |language=German |date=21 January 2012 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> After a successful surgery, it was announced that he would be out for six weeks.<ref>{{cite news |title=Prödl operiert – Allofs: Wir werden etwas machen |url=http://www.bild.de/regional/bremen/proedl-operiert--allofs-wir-werden-etwas-22257850.bild.html |work=Bild |language=German |date=24 January 2012 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> Prödl made his return against [[Hannover 96]] on 11 March 2012 scoring in a 3–0 win.<ref>{{cite news |title=Pizarro serviert Hannover die Rechnung |url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/bundesliga/spieltag/1-bundesliga/2011-12/25/1143506/spielanalyse_werder-bremen-4_hannover-96-58.html |publisher=Kicker.de |language=German |date=11 March 2012 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> However, his return was short-lived as he suffered a hamstring injury which kept him out for two weeks.<ref>{{cite news |title=Mielitz darf träumen, Prödl muss pausieren |url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/bundesliga/startseite/566320/artikel_mielitz-darf-traeumen-proedl-muss-pausieren.html |publisher=Kicker.de |language=German |date=20 March 2013 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> He made his return to the first team on 28 April 2012, in a 3–1 loss against [[VfL Wolfsburg|Wolfsburg]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Dank Helmes – Wolfsburg träumt weiter von Europa |url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/bundesliga/spieltag/1-bundesliga/2011-12/33/1143576/spielanalyse_vfl-wolfsburg-24_werder-bremen-4.html |publisher=Kicker.de |language=German |date=28 April 2012 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> Having made 16 appearances in the 2011–12 season, it was announced that Prödl had signed a new three-year contract with the club, which would keep him at the club until summer 2015.<ref>{{cite news |title=Prödl verlängert beim SV Werder bis 2015 |url=http://www.werder.de/de/profis/news/39007.php |publisher=SV Werder Bremen |language=German |date=2 May 2012 |accessdate=24 June 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160120220657/http://www.werder.de/de/profis/news/39007.php |archivedate=20 January 2016 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
After playing two matches of the 2012–13 season, Prödl suffered injuries first to his thigh<ref>{{cite news |title=Werders Ekici fehlt wegen Grippe |url=http://www.bild.de/regional/bremen/werders-ekici-fehlt-wegen-grippe-26257456.bild.html |work=Bild |language=German |date=18 September 2012 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> and then his head.<ref>{{cite news |title=Bremer Prödl erleidet Kopfverletzung |url=http://www.bild.de/regional/bremen/bremer-proedl-erleidet-kopfverletzung-26747166.bild.html |work=Bild |language=German |date=17 October 2012 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> Upon his return, he scored his first goal of the season in a 4–1 win over Hoffenheim on 2 December 2012.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://espnfc.com/us/en/report/346277/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=5901 |title=TSG Hoffenheim 1–4 Werder Bremen |publisher=[[ESPN FC]] |date=2 December 2012 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> On 23 February 2013, he was sent-off in the 44th minute of a match against [[FC Bayern Munich|Bayern Munich]] for a foul on [[Mario Gómez]]; Werder Bremen went on to lose 6–1.<ref>{{cite news |title=Robben leitet den Kantersieg ein |url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/bundesliga/spieltag/1-bundesliga/2012-13/23/1441841/spielanalyse_bayern-muenchen-14_werder-bremen-4.html |publisher=Kicker.de |language=German |date=23 February 2013 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> He was given a two-match ban for the red card.<ref>{{cite news |title=Bremens Prödl für zwei Spiele gesperrt |url=http://www.bild.de/regional/bremen/bremens-proedl-fuer-zwei-spiele-gesperrt-29269182.bild.html |work=Bild |language=German |date=25 February 2013 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> In a match against [[Fortuna Düsseldorf]] on 13 April 2013 he was appointed captain and played the full 90 minutes of a 2–2 draw.<ref>{{cite news |title=Reisinger ist der Blitzstarter, Latka der Pechvogel |url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/bundesliga/spieltag/1-bundesliga/2012-13/29/1441903/spielanalyse_fortuna-duesseldorf-13_werder-bremen-4.html |publisher=Kicker.de |language=German |date=13 April 2013 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> Prödl finished the 2012–13 season with 28 caps.
In the 2013–14 season, Prödl scored in the club's first match without [[Thomas Schaaf]], which Werder Bremen lost 3–1 to [[1. FC Saarbrücken|Saarbrücken]] in the first round of DFB Pokal.<ref>{{cite news |title=Bremen, Braunschweig, GladbachBundesligisten stürzen im DFB-Pokal |url=http://www.n24.de/n24/Sport/Fussball/dfb-pokal/d/3292928/bundesligisten-stuerzen-im-dfb-pokal.html |publisher=N24.de |language=German |date=4 August 2013 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> In the opening game of the season against [[Eintracht Braunschweig]], he provided the assist for compatriot [[Zlatko Junuzović]] to score the only goal in the game.<ref>{{cite news |title=Junuzovic jubelt: Löwen zahlen Lehrgeld |url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/bundesliga/spieltag/1-bundesliga/2013-14/1/1894566/spielanalyse_eintracht-braunschweig-41_werder-bremen-4.html |publisher=Kicker.de |language=German |date=10 August 2013 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> He then suffered a muscle injury which kept him out for two weeks.<ref>{{cite news |title=Werder-Profi Prödl fällt mit Muskelverletzung zwei Wochen aus |url=http://www.bild.de/regional/bremen/werderprofi-proedl-faellt-mit-muskelverletzung-33148726.bild.html |work=Bild |language=German |date=27 October 2013 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> By 21 November 2013, his recovery was delayed by three weeks.<ref>{{cite news |title=Pause für Ösis immer länger |url=http://www.bild.de/sport/fussball/werder-bremen/pause-fuer-oesis-wird-immer-laenger-33496252.bild.html |work=Bild |language=German |date=21 November 2013 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> After making his return, Prödl captained four matches between 1 February 2014 and 1 March 2014. He scored two goals in two matches against Wolfsburg<ref>{{cite news |title=1:3 gegen Wolfsburg: Werder zurück im Abstiegskampf |url=http://www.n24.de/n24/Sport/Fussball/1-bundesliga/d/4491364/1-3-gegen-wolfsburg--werder-zurueck-im-abstiegskampf.html |publisher=N24.de |language=German |date=25 March 2014 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> and Hannover 96.<ref>{{cite news |title=Prödl sorgt für den Bremer Befreiungsschlag |url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/bundesliga/spieltag/1-bundesliga/2013-14/28/1895122/spielanalyse_hannover-96-58_werder-bremen-4.html |work=Bild |language=German |date=30 March 2014 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> In March 2014, he stated he would let his contract run out in 2015 if his contract would not be renewed in the summer.<ref>{{cite news |title=Prödl fordert Zeichen von Werder |url=http://www.zeit.de/news/2014-03/11/fussball-proedl-fordert-zeichen-von-werder-11163406 |accessdate=26 September 2016 |work=Die Zeit |date=11 March 2014}}</ref> At the end of the season, Prödl had made 27 appearances helping the club avoid relegation and finish in 14th place.<ref>{{cite news |title=Prödl: "Das wird eine schwere Saison!" |url=http://www.bild.de/sport/fussball/sebastian-proedl/abstiegsangst-wird-eine-schwere-saison-31694288.bild.html |work=Bild |language=German |date=7 August 2013 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref>
After missing two games at the start of the 2014–15 season due to a hamstring injury,<ref>{{cite news |title=Werder-Verteidiger Gebre Selassie kaputt |url=http://www.bild.de/sport/fussball/werder-bremen/gebre-selassie-kaputt-37204232.bild.html |work=Bild |language=German |date=12 August 2014 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> Prödl scored his first goal of the season on 12 September 2014, in a 3–3 draw against Bayer Leverkusen.<ref>{{cite news |title=BundesligaBayers Spaß-Fußballer zahlen die Zeche – 'Werden nix ändern' |url=http://www.n24.de/n24/Sport/Fussball/1-bundesliga/d/5394244/bayers-spass-fussballer-zahlen-die-zeche----werden-nix-aendern-.html |publisher=N24.de |language=German |date=13 September 2014 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> He then missed one match, due to injury, first suffering the flu,<ref>{{cite news |title=Wegen Darm-Virus – Werder ohne zwei Stars |url=http://www.bild.de/sport/fussball/werder-bremen/zwei-stars-fehlen-gegen-schalke-37785304.bild.html |work=Bild |language=German |date=23 September 2014 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> then a hip problem.<ref>{{cite news |title=Wolf kann ran, Prödl vor Rückkehr |url=http://www.bild.de/sport/fussball/werder-bremen/gibt-entwarnung-38703290.bild.html |work=Bild |language=German |date=25 November 2014 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> His hip injury came after scoring his second goal of the season, in a 2–0 win over [[VfB Stuttgart|Stuttgart]] on 8 November 2014.<ref>{{cite news |title=Zweimal Ecke, zweimal Tor: Werder feiert weiter |url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/bundesliga/spieltag/1-bundesliga/2014-15/11/2407323/spielanalyse_werder-bremen-4_vfb-stuttgart-11.html#omsearchresult |publisher=Kicker.de |language=German |date=8 November 2014 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> In a 5–2 defeat to Frankfurt, Prödl was substituted off in the first half and it was announced after the match that he would be out for six to eight weeks.<ref>{{cite news |title=Bremens Prödl fällt bis zu zwei Monate aus |url=http://www.n24.de/n24/Sport/Fussball/1-bundesliga/d/5831848/bremens-proedl-faellt-bis-zu-zwei-monate-aus.html |publisher=N24.de |language=German |date=8 December 2014 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> He scored on his return on 21 February 2015, in a 1–1 draw against [[FC Schalke 04|Schalke 04]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Schalke beendet Werders Siegesserie |url=http://www.n24.de/n24/Sport/Fussball/1-bundesliga/d/6186050/schalke-beendet-werders-siegesserie-.html |publisher=N24.de |language=German |date=21 February 2015 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> During the season, he captained his team on five different occasions and made 22 league appearances, scoring three goals.
On 12 May 2015, it was announced that Prödl would leave Bremen at the end of the 2014–15 season, as his contract had come to an end.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.dfb.de/news/detail/proedl-verlaesst-werder-nach-sieben-jahren-122798/ |title=Prödl verlässt Werder nach sieben Jahren |date=12 May 2015 |work=dfb.de/}}</ref> The club previously offered him a new contract at the start of the season.<ref>{{cite news |title=Neues Angebot für Prödl & Junuzovic |url=http://www.bild.de/sport/fussball/werder-bremen/neues-angebot-fuer-proedl-und-junuzovic-37539016.bild.html |work=Bild |language=German |date=5 September 2014 |accessdate=24 June 2015}}</ref> During his time at Bremen he scored 10 goals, playing predominately in the central defence role.
===Watford=== On 1 June 2015, Prödl signed for [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] on a five-year contract after his contract at Werder Bremen had ended.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.watfordfc.com/news/article/150601-watford-fc-sebastian-prodl-watford-fc-2477080.aspx |title=Sebastian Prodl Signs |date=1 June 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150601200243/http://www.watfordfc.com/news/article/150601-watford-fc-sebastian-prodl-watford-fc-2477080.aspx |archivedate=1 June 2015 |deadurl=no}}</ref> He became Watford's first signing on their return to the [[Premier League]]. Upon joining the club, he was given number five shirt ahead of a new season.<ref>{{cite news |title=Watford confirm squad numbers for Premier League |url=http://www.watfordobserver.co.uk/sport/13524340.Hornets_confirm_squad_numbers/ |work=Watford Observer |date=4 August 2015 |accessdate=4 October 2016}}</ref>
Prödl made his Watford debut in the opening game of the season, making his first start in a 2–2 draw against [[Everton F.C.|Everton]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Everton 2 – 2 Watford |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33744642 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=8 August 2015 |accessdate=4 October 2016}}</ref> He remained as a first team regular at the start of the season until he was dropped to the bench in late October ahead of a match against [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]],<ref>{{cite news |title=Troy Deeney and Almen Abdi score as Watford deservedly beat Stoke City at Britannia Stadium |url=http://www.watfordobserver.co.uk/sport/13894206.Superb_Hornets_sink_Potters/ |work=Watford Observer |date=24 October 2015 |accessdate=4 October 2016}}</ref> and soon suffered a calf injury during international duty with Austria.<ref>{{cite news |title=Sebastian Prodl is out for three weeks with a calf injury but Valon Behrami could be fit for Watford's trip to Aston Villa |url=http://www.watfordobserver.co.uk/sport/14105614.Prodl_out_for_three_weeks_but_Behrami_could_face_Villa/ |work=Watford Observer |date=24 November 2015 |accessdate=4 October 2016}}</ref> As the 2015–16 season progressed towards the end, Prödl would be often be in and out of both in the starting eleven and substitute bench. He scored his first goal for Watford in a 3–1 defeat to [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] on 20 April 2016.<ref>{{cite news |title=West Ham United 3 – 1 Watford |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35733431 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 April 2016 |accessdate=4 October 2016}}</ref> On the last game of the season, he scored his second goal of the season, in a 2–2 draw against [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Watford 2 – 2 Sunderland |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/36240332 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=15 May 2016 |accessdate=4 October 2016}}</ref>
Despite being linked with a move to [[Serie A]] side [[Udinese Calcio|Udinese]],<ref>{{cite news |title=Udinese mit Interesse an Watfords Sebastain Prödl? |url=http://www.spox.com/de/sport/fussball/international/italien/1608/News/udinese-calcio-sebastian-proedl-fc-watford-interesse-verpflichtung.html |publisher=Spox.com |language=German |date=22 August 2016 |accessdate=4 October 2016}}</ref> Prödl remained at the club and regained his first team place under the management of [[Walter Mazzarri]]. In a 3–1 win over [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] on 18 September 2016,<ref>{{cite news |title=Watford 3 – 1 Manchester United |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37331599 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=18 September 2016 |accessdate=4 October 2016}}</ref> he was praised for his performance and was named Man of the Match.<ref>{{cite news |title=Prodl: It was a massive performance |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/105649 |publisher=Premier League Official Website |date=18 September 2016 |accessdate=4 October 2016}}</ref> In May 2017, he was named Watford's player of the season.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Walker |first1=Ron |title=Sebastian Prodl wins Watford player of the season award at Wembley ceremony |url=http://www.watfordobserver.co.uk/sport/15303063.Prodl_named_Hornets__player_of_the_year/ |accessdate=24 May 2017 |work=Watford Observer |date=23 May 2017}}</ref>
==International career== In 2007, he was called to play for [[Austria national football team|Austria]]. He served as captain of Austria's U-20 national team at the [[2007 FIFA U-20 World Cup|2007 U-20 World Cup]]<ref>{{FIFA player|269792}}</ref> in Canada where he helped his team to a fourth-place finish. After the tournament was over he was the only Austrian voted into the U-20 World Cup line-up by Italian magazine ''[[Gazzetta dello Sport]]''.<ref>{{cite news |title=U20-Teamkapitän Prödl unter besten WM-Spielern: Argentinier Aguero siegt leider! |url=http://www.news.at/a/u20-teamkapitaen-proedl-wm-spielern-argentinier-aguero-178957 |publisher=news.at |language=German |date=23 July 2007 |accessdate=4 October 2016}}</ref>
After being called up to the national team for the first team in May 2007,<ref>{{cite news |title=ÖFB-Teamkader mit Patocka, Sebastain Prödl und Erwin Hoffer |url=http://diepresse.com/home/sport/fussball/304476/OFBTeamkader-mit-Patocka-Prodl-und-Hoffer?from=suche.intern.portal |publisher=Die Presse |language=German |date=16 May 2007 |accessdate=4 October 2016}}</ref> Prödl made his senior debut for [[Austria national football team|Austria]] on 30 May 2007 against [[Scotland national football team|Scotland]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Österreich geizte mit Leistung |url=http://www.vol.at/oesterreich-geizte-mit-leistung/news-20070530-10211552 |publisher=Vorarlberg Online |language=German |date=30 May 2007 |accessdate=4 October 2016}}</ref> On 26 March 2008, Prödl scored two goals in an international friendly against the [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands]]. On 12 June 2008 during the [[UEFA Euro 2008|Euro 2008]] [[UEFA Euro 2008 Group B#Austria vs Poland|Austria vs. Poland]] game he was fouled in the 92nd minute in the penalty area and the referee, [[Howard Webb]], awarded Austria a penalty kick, resulting in their only goal of the tournament.<ref>{{cite news |last=Aikman |first=Richard |title=Vastic rides to Austria's rescue against Poland |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/news/newsid=706835.html |accessdate=31 March 2014 |publisher=[[UEFA]] |date=13 June 2008}}</ref>
==Personal life== Prödl's cousin [[Viktoria Schnaderbeck]] is also a footballer<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.kleinezeitung.at/sport/fussball/2706548/bayern-legionaerin-schnaderbeck-erlitt-meniskusriss.story |title=Bayern-Legionärin Schnaderbeck erlitt Meniskusriss |language=German |publisher=kleinezeitung.at |date=24 March 2011 |accessdate=2 January 2013}}</ref> who plays for [[Arsenal W.F.C.|Arsenal Women]] and the [[Austria women's national football team]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.arsenal.com/news/viktoria-schnaderbeck-joins-club |title=Viktoria Schnaderbeck joins the club |publisher=Arsenal F.C. |accessdate=24 May 2018}}</ref><ref>[https://www.worldfootball.net/teams/oesterreich-frauen-team/10/ Austria [Women<nowiki>]</nowiki> » Players and coaches from A-Z]. ''worldfootball.net''. Retrieved 26 August 2018.</ref><ref>[https://www.uefa.com/womensworldcup/season=2015/teams/team=500008/squad/index.html Austria – Women's]. ''UEFA.com''. Retrieved 26 August 2018.</ref>
