{{Use British English|date=January 2012}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2018}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Tom Cleverley | image = Tom Cleverley 2015.jpg | image_size = 200 | caption = Cleverley playing for [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] in 2015 | fullname = Thomas William Cleverley{{cite book |editor-first=Barry J. |editor-last=Hugman |title=The PFA Footballers' Who's Who 2010–11 |year=2010 |publisher=Mainstream Publishing |location=Edinburgh |isbn=978-1-84596-601-0 |page=86}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1989|8|12|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Basingstoke]], England | height = {{convert|1.75|m|order=flip}}{{cite web |url=https://uk.soccerway.com/players/tom-cleverley/70764/ |title=T. Cleverley: Summary |website=Soccerway |publisher=Perform Group |accessdate=18 May 2018}} | position = [[Midfielder]] | currentclub = [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] | clubnumber = 8 | youthyears1 = 1998–2000 |youthclubs1 = [[Bradford City A.F.C.|Bradford City]] | youthyears2 = 2000–2008 |youthclubs2 = [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] | years1 = 2008–2015 |clubs1 = [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] |caps1 = 55 |goals1 = 3 | years2 = 2009 |clubs2 = → [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]] (loan) |caps2 = 15 |goals2 = 2 | years3 = 2009–2010 |clubs3 = → [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] (loan) |caps3 = 33 |goals3 = 11 | years4 = 2010–2011 |clubs4 = → [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]] (loan) |caps4 = 25 |goals4 = 4 | years5 = 2014–2015 |clubs5 = → [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] (loan) |caps5 = 31 |goals5 = 3 | years6 = 2015–2017 |clubs6 = [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] |caps6 = 32 |goals6 = 2 | years7 = 2017 |clubs7 = → [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] (loan) |caps7 = 17 |goals7 = 0 | years8 = 2017– |clubs8 = [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] |caps8 = 32 |goals8 = 2 | nationalyears1 = 2009 |nationalteam1 = [[England national under-20 football team|England U20]] |nationalcaps1 = 1 |nationalgoals1 = 2 | nationalyears2 = 2009–2011 |nationalteam2 = [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] |nationalcaps2 = 16 |nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2012 |nationalteam3 = [[Great Britain Olympic football team|Great Britain]] |nationalcaps3 = 5 |nationalgoals3 = 0 | nationalyears4 = 2012– |nationalteam4 = [[England national football team|England]] |nationalcaps4 = 13 |nationalgoals4 = 0 | club-update = 08:24, 26 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 22:43, 18 May 2018 (UTC) }} '''Thomas William Cleverley''' (born 12 August 1989) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[midfielder]] for {{English football updater|Watford}} club [[Watford F.C.|Watford]]. After starting his career in the youth set-up at [[Bradford City A.F.C.|Bradford City]], Cleverley joined Manchester United at the age of 12. Between 2007 and 2009 he played for Manchester United's reserve team, and occasionally in first-team [[Exhibition game#Association football|friendly match]]es. Cleverley was [[Loan (sports)|loaned]] to [[EFL League One|League One]] club [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]] at the start of 2009, for whom he made his first [[English Football League|Football League]] appearances, helping the team secure the League One title and promotion to the [[EFL Championship|Championship]]. He spent the [[2009–10 Watford F.C. season|2009–10 season]] on loan with Watford in the Championship, where he scored 11 goals in 33 league matches and was voted as their [[Watford F.C. Player of the Season|Player of the Season]]. On 31 August 2010, he joined [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]] on a season-long loan, where he scored four goals in 25 appearances and helped them to avoid relegation on the final day of the season. He returned to Manchester United for the start of the [[2011–12 Manchester United F.C. season|2011–12 season]] and made his first competitive appearance in the [[FA Community Shield]] victory against [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]]. He won the Premier League with Manchester United in 2013. Cleverley played for [[Great Britain Olympic football team|Great Britain]] at the [[Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament|2012 Summer Olympics]], and later that year made his debut for the [[England national football team|England national team]]. ==Club career== ===Early career=== Cleverley was born in [[Basingstoke]], Hampshire, but grew up in [[Bradford]], West Yorkshire.{{cite web |first=Gemma |last=Thompson |title=Dream debut for Tom |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2008/Jul/Dream-debut-for-Tom.aspx |publisher=Manchester United |page=1 |date=26 July 2008 |accessdate=16 January 2009|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121012214131/http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2008/Jul/Dream-debut-for-Tom.aspx |archivedate=12 October 2012 |deadurl=no}} He went to [[Hanson School]].{{cite web |title=Famous Students |url=http://www.hansonoldstudents.org/links/ |publisher=Hanson Old Students Association |accessdate=15 January 2019 }} He was part of [[Bradford City A.F.C.|Bradford City's]] youth set-up, but joined [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] as an 11-year-old trainee in July 2000.{{cite news|title=Tom Cleverley exclusive: Why I was right to leave Manchester United and Everton|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/08/25/tom-cleverley-exclusive-right-leave-manchester-united-everton/|work=The Daily Telegraph|date=25 August 2017|accessdate=22 October 2017}} During the 2005–06 season, he made nine appearances for the under-18 team. He also received a taste of reserve team football when he was named on the bench for the team's 4–1 away win over [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] on 21 February 2006.{{cite news|title=Manchester United's Wonderkid – Tom Cleverley: Do You Know Him?|url=http://www.goal.com/en-india/news/2292/editorials/2011/08/08/2610406/manchester-uniteds-wonderkid-tom-cleverley-do-you-know-him|publisher=Goal.com|date=8 August 2011|accessdate=16 August 2016}} His first appearance for the reserves came in a 0–0 away draw to [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]] almost a year later, on 15 February 2007, by which time he had become a regular in the under-18 team. However, just over a month later, he suffered a long-term injury and was ruled out for seven months.{{cite news|title=United kids can make Paul proud|url=https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/united-kids-can-make-paul-989648|newspaper=Manchester Evening News|date=26 April 2007|accessdate=16 August 2016}} He returned to action in October 2007, playing for the reserves in a 1–1 home draw with [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]]. The 2007–08 season marked Cleverley's emergence as a regular in the Manchester United reserve team, making 21 appearances as the team went on to win both the [[Manchester Senior Cup]] and the [[Lancashire Senior Cup]], in which he scored in the final against Liverpool.{{cite news|title=Glory for young Reds|url=https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/glory-for-young-reds-962573|newspaper=Manchester Evening News|date=19 April 2010|accessdate=16 August 2016}} He also scored his first goals in a Manchester United shirt on 23 January 2008, when he scored both of United's goals in a 2–0 away win over Bolton Wanderers in the [[Premier Reserve League]]. His consistent performances for the reserves earned him the captaincy of the team in the absence of regular captain [[Sam Hewson]], as well as a nomination for the Denzil Haroun Reserve Player of the Year award – he lost out to [[Richard Eckersley (footballer)|Richard Eckersley]]. In recognition of his performances for the reserves, on 24 July 2008, Cleverley was called up to the Manchester United first team for the remainder of their tour of South Africa and the match against [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]] in Nigeria.{{cite news |first=Gemma |last=Thompson |title=Trio join senior squad |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2008/Jul/Trio-join-senior-squad.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=24 July 2008 |accessdate=16 January 2009|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304054823/http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2008/Jul/Trio-join-senior-squad.aspx |archivedate=4 March 2016 |deadurl=no}} He made his first-team debut against [[Kaizer Chiefs FC|Kaizer Chiefs]] in the final of the 2008 Vodacom Challenge, coming on in place of [[Rodrigo Possebon]] at half-time, before he scored the third of United's four goals just after the hour mark.{{cite news |first=Nick |last=Coppack |title=Report: Chiefs 0 United 4 |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Fixtures-And-Results/Match-Reports/2008/Jul/Report-Chiefs-0-United-4.aspx?pageNo=3 |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |page=3 |date=26 July 2008 |accessdate=16 January 2009 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304054812/http://www.manutd.com/en/Fixtures-And-Results/Match-Reports/2008/Jul/Report-Chiefs-0-United-4.aspx?pageNo=3 |archivedate=4 March 2016 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} He returned to regular reserve team duty for the 2008–09 season, but was given a first-team squad number – 35 – when the first-team squad list was announced on 15 August 2008,{{cite news |first=Ben |last=Hibbs |title=Reds squad numbers registered |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2008/Aug/Squad-numbers-registered.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=15 August 2008 |accessdate=15 August 2008|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304061947/http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2008/Aug/Squad-numbers-registered.aspx |archivedate=4 March 2016 |deadurl=no}} and was named on the bench for United's [[2008–09 Football League Cup|League Cup]] matches against [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] and [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]].{{cite news |title=Manchester United 3–1 Middlesbrough|url=http://newsimg.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/league_cup/7626743.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=23 September 2008 |accessdate=23 September 2008}}
{{cite news |first=Sam |last=Lyon |title=Manchester United 1–0 Queens Park Rangers|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/league_cup/7708789.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=11 November 2008 |accessdate=12 November 2008}} ===Loan spells=== ====Leicester City==== On 16 January 2009, Cleverley joined [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]] on [[Loan (sports)|loan]] for the remainder of the 2008–09 season and was given the number 7 shirt.{{cite news |title=United Midfielder Joins Foxes |url=http://www.lcfc.com/page/LatestNews/0,,10274~1522804,00.html |publisher=Leicester City F.C. |date=16 January 2009 |accessdate=16 January 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120913050839/http://www.lcfc.com/page/LatestNews/0%2C%2C10274~1522804%2C00.html |archivedate=13 September 2012 }} He made his debut on 19 January 2009 in a 2–0 away win over [[Yeovil Town F.C.|Yeovil Town]], coming on as an 85th-minute substitute for [[Matty Fryatt]].{{cite news |title=Yeovil 0–2 Leicester |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_2/7816036.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=19 January 2009 |accessdate=19 January 2009}} Cleverley scored his first Leicester City goal few weeks later on 3 February 2009, in a 4–1 win over [[Walsall F.C.|Walsall]].{{cite news|title=Walsall 1–4 Leicester City|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_2/7869349.stm|publisher=BBC Sport|date=3 February 2009|accessdate=16 August 2016}} Cleverley then scored his second goal for the club on 7 March 2009, in a 4–0 win over [[Cheltenham Town F.C.|Cheltenham Town]].{{cite news|title=Match report: Leicester City 4–0 Cheltenham Town|url=http://www.leicestermercury.co.uk/city-verdict-impressive-display-fires-clear-warning-chasing-pack/story-12065076-detail/story.html|newspaper=Leicester Mercury|date=7 March 2009|accessdate=16 August 2016}}{{dead link|date=February 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} After two goals in 15 matches for Leicester, Cleverley's loan spell came to a premature end after he suffered a season-ending shoulder injury against [[Colchester United F.C.|Colchester United]].{{cite news|title=Anxious wait for Tom Cleverley|url=http://www.leicestermercury.co.uk/anxious-wait-cleverley/story-12048221-detail/story.html|newspaper=Leicester Mercury|date=23 March 2009|accessdate=16 August 2016}}{{dead link|date=February 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} He then returned to Manchester United for treatment and underwent surgery on his shoulder on 2 April 2009.{{cite web |title=Cleverley sends message to fans |url=http://www.lcfc.com/page/LatestNews/0,,10274~1607650,00.html |publisher=Leicester City F.C. |date=31 March 2009 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090403172603/http://www.lcfc.com/page/LatestNews/0,,10274~1607650,00.html |archivedate=3 April 2009 |deadurl=yes}} Although his loan had ended, Cleverley was presented with a medal on 24 April after Leicester secured their promotion as champions of [[EFL League One|League One]].{{cite web |title=Champions picture special |url=http://www.lcfc.com/page/LatestNews/0,,10274~1638777,00.html |publisher=Leicester City F.C. |date=25 April 2009 |accessdate=25 April 2009 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090428152937/http://www.lcfc.com/page/LatestNews/0,,10274~1638777,00.html |archivedate=28 April 2009 |deadurl=yes}} Towards the end of the season, along with [[James Chester]] and [[Corry Evans]], Cleverley was nominated by Manchester United reserve team manager [[Ole Gunnar Solskjær]] for the Denzil Haroun Reserve Player of the Year award.{{cite news |first=Adam |last=Bostock |title=Reserve Player of the Year |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Players-And-Staff/Reserves/Reserves-News/2009/Apr/Reserve-Player-of-the-Year.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=1 April 2009 |accessdate=1 April 2009 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121013014509/http://www.manutd.com/en/Players-And-Staff/Reserves/Reserves-News/2009/Apr/Reserve-Player-of-the-Year.aspx |archivedate=13 October 2012 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} ====Watford==== After being featured and scored in the pre–season [[Exhibition game#Association football|friendly match]] against [[Valencia CF|Valencia]], Cleverley was told by [[Alex Ferguson]] that he would be loaned out to gain further first-team experience.{{cite news|title=Cleverley's a wanted man|url=https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/cleverleys-a-wanted-man-926542|newspaper=Manchester Evening News|date=7 August 2009|accessdate=16 August 2016}} On 18 August 2009, Cleverley signed for [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] on loan, and was able to play in their match away to [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]] that evening.{{cite news |title=Watford seal Cleverley loan deal|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/w/watford/8206810.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=18 August 2009 |accessdate=18 August 2009}} He started the match and was booked within four minutes of the start of the second half, but then sealed a 4–2 win with a goal in the second minute of injury time at the end of the match.{{cite news |title=Nottingham Forest 2–4 Watford|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_1/8195606.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=18 August 2009 |accessdate=18 August 2009}} He then scored another goal on his home debut four days later, scoring Watford's second goal in a 2–2 draw with [[Blackpool F.C.|Blackpool]],{{cite news |title=Watford 2–2 Blackpool |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_1/8202363.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=22 August 2009 |accessdate=22 August 2009}} and became Watford's joint-top scorer with the second goal in a 2–0 win over [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]] in November.{{cite news |title=Watford 2–0 Preston |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_1/8341219.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=7 November 2009 |accessdate=7 November 2009}} Shortly afterwards, he extended his loan deal at Watford until the end of the [[2009–10 Watford F.C. season|2009–10 season]].{{cite web |title=Cleverley commits |url=http://www.watfordfc.com/page/NewsDetail/0,,10400~1880013,00.html |publisher=Watford F.C. |date=20 November 2009 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091121120433/http://www.watfordfc.com/page/NewsDetail/0,,10400~1880013,00.html|archivedate=21 November 2009 |deadurl=yes}} Cleverley scored a further five goals in 20 appearances for Watford before a knee ligament injury in April 2010 ended his season prematurely.{{cite news |title=Watford midfielder Tom Cleverley out for season |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/w/watford/8610377.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=8 April 2010 |accessdate=9 April 2010}} He went on to win the team's [[Watford F.C. Player of the Season|Player of the Season]] award.{{cite web |title=Player of the Season|url=http://www.watfordfc.com/page/NewsDetail/0,,10400~2028625,00.html |publisher=Watford F.C. |date=18 April 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100421030032/http://www.watfordfc.com/page/NewsDetail/0,,10400~2028625,00.html|archivedate=21 April 2010 |deadurl=yes}} ====Wigan Athletic==== [[File:Tom Cleverley goal vs MLS All-Stars cropped.jpg|thumb|upright|Cleverley playing for [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] in 2010]] On 1 July 2010, Cleverley signed a new contract with the club, keeping him until 2013.{{cite news|title=Cleverley signs three year deal|url=https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/cleverley-signs-three-year-deal-893216|newspaper=Manchester Evening News|date=1 July 2010|accessdate=16 August 2016}} Cleverley returned to Manchester United for the beginning of the 2010–11 season, and travelled with the squad for their pre-season tour of North America in July 2010.{{cite news |first=Gemma |last=Thompson |title=Tour squad announced |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2010/Jul/Tour-squad-announced.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=9 July 2010 |accessdate=9 July 2010|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121013014658/http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2010/Jul/Tour-squad-announced.aspx|archivedate=13 October 2012 |deadurl=no}} He came on as a substitute for [[Ryan Giggs]] at half-time in the first match of the tour against [[Celtic F.C.|Celtic]] in Toronto, and scored United's third in a 3–1 win.{{cite news |first=Gemma |last=Thompson |title=Celtic 1 United 3 |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Fixtures-And-Results/Match-Reports/2010/Jul/Celtic-1-United-3.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=16 July 2010 |accessdate=17 July 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121013014722/http://www.manutd.com/en/Fixtures-And-Results/Match-Reports/2010/Jul/Celtic-1-United-3.aspx |archivedate=13 October 2012 |deadurl=yes }} He then netted his second of the tour on 28 July 2010, scoring United's fourth in their 5–2 win in the [[2010 MLS All-Star Game]]; he controlled [[Darren Fletcher]]'s flick into the box before lifting the ball over [[Wilman Conde]]'s head and side-footing it past [[Nick Rimando]].{{cite news |first=Gemma |last=Thompson |title=MLS All-Stars 2 United 5 |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Fixtures-And-Results/Match-Reports/2010/Jul/MLS-AllStars-2-United-5.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=28 July 2010 |accessdate=28 July 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121007154842/http://www.manutd.com/en/Fixtures-And-Results/Match-Reports/2010/Jul/MLS-AllStars-2-United-5.aspx|archivedate=7 October 2012 |deadurl=no}} On 31 August 2010, although Cleverley looked destined to stay with United for the season,{{cite news|title=Manchester United boss Sir Alex Feguson wants Premier League loans for youngsters Danny Welbeck and Tom Cleverley|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-1296873/Danny-Welbeck-Tom-Cleverley-Premier-League-loan-moves.html |newspaper=Daily Mail |location=London |date=22 July 2010|accessdate=16 August 2016}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}} [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]] confirmed they had agreed a season-long loan deal for Cleverley,{{cite web |title=Tom Clevlerley joins Roberto revolution |url=http://www.wiganlatics.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10429~2140646,00.html |publisher=Wigan Athletic F.C. |date=31 August 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100903102401/http://www.wiganlatics.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10429~2140646,00.html|archivedate=3 September 2010 |deadurl=yes}} with Manchester United retaining the option to recall the player from his loan spell in January.{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,11095_6630369,00.html |title=Latics fear Cleverley recall |publisher=Sky Sports |date=2 January 2011 |accessdate=31 January 2011}} On 11 September 2010, Cleverley made his debut for Wigan which was also his [[Premier League]] debut, replacing [[Mauro Boselli]] in the 75th minute and assisting [[Antolin Alcaraz]] in a 1–1 home draw against [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]].{{cite news |first=Les |last=Roopanarine |title=Wigan 1–1 Sunderland|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/8977470.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=12 September 2010 |accessdate=11 September 2010}} However, Cleverley suffered a knock, resulting a knee injury in training and was sidelined for weeks.{{cite news|title=Cleverley setback for Latics|url=https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/cleverley-setback-for-latics-899315|newspaper=Manchester Evening News|date=22 September 2010|accessdate=16 August 2016}} Cleverley then made his first-team return on 16 October 2010, coming on as a substitute for [[Ronnie Stam]] in the 79th minutes, in a 2–2 draw against [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]].{{cite news|title=Newcastle United 2–2 Wigan Athletic|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/9093223.stm|publisher=BBC Sport|date=16 October 2010|accessdate=16 August 2016}} On 27 November, he scored his first goal for the club, also his first ever Premier League goal, in a 3–1 defeat away to [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]].{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/9221078.stm |title=West Ham 3–1 Wigan |publisher=BBC Sport |date=27 November 2010 |accessdate=27 November 2010}} Seven days later he scored his second for Wigan and first home goal in a 2–2 draw against [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]].{{cite news |first=Julian |last=Shea |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/9239609.stm |title=Wigan 2–2 Stoke |publisher=BBC Sport |date=4 December 2010 |accessdate=4 December 2010}} However, following a [[Dubious Goals Committee|Dubious Goals Panel]] ruling, this goal was taken away from Cleverley and credited as a [[Rory Delap]] own goal.{{cite news |url=http://www.premierleague.com/page/Headlines/0,,12306~2361167,00.html |title=Dubious goals panel ruling |publisher=Premier League |date=16 May 2011 |accessdate=16 May 2011}} On 31 January 2011, Manchester United agreed to let Cleverley stay on loan at Wigan until the end of the season.{{cite news |first=Pete |last=O'Rourke |url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,11095_6714155,00.html |title=Cleverley stays with Latics |publisher=Sky Sports |date=31 January 2011 |accessdate=31 January 2011}} Cleverley scored the decisive goal in a 2–1 away win over [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] which lifted Wigan out of the relegation zone.{{cite news |first=Jamie |last=Lillywhite |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/9306174.stm |title=Wolverhampton 1–2 Wigan |publisher=BBC Sport |date=4 December 2010 |accessdate=4 December 2010}} However, Cleverley suffered a hamstring injury that kept him out for a month.{{cite news|title=Hull City vs Wigan Athletic: FA Cup Preview|url=https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/hull-v-wigan-fa-cup-851185|newspaper=Manchester Evening News|date=7 January 2011|accessdate=16 August 2016}} Cleverley then made his return from the first team on 5 February 2011, where he came on as a substitute for [[Victor Moses]] in the 67th minutes, in a 4–3 win over [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]].{{cite news|title=Wigan Athletic 4–3 Blackburn Rovers|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/9384149.stm|publisher=BBC Sport|date=5 February 2011|accessdate=16 August 2016}} After making return to the first team, Cleverley then scored and set up one of the goal, which turned out to be a winning goal, in a 2–1 win over [[Birmingham City F.C.|Birmingham City]] on 19 March 2011.{{cite news|title=Wigan Athletic 2–1 Birmingham City|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/9426720.stm|publisher=BBC Sport|date=19 March 2011|accessdate=16 August 2016}} Cleverley was one of Wigan's stand-out performers, and ended the season with three goals and two assists in 25 Premier League appearances.{{cite web|title=Wigan Athletic 2010/11 Season|url= https://www.whoscored.com/Teams/194/Archive?stageId=4345|publisher=WhoScored.com}} ===Return to Manchester United=== ====2011–12 season==== [[Paul Scholes]]' retirement before the [[2011–12 Manchester United F.C. season|2011–12 season]] left an opening in Manchester United's central midfield. Cleverley was identified by manager Alex Ferguson as a potential homegrown replacement for Scholes.{{cite news|title=Tom Cleverley makes bid to become the next Paul Scholes for Manchester United|url=https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/tom-cleverley-makes-bid-become-862837|newspaper=Manchester Evening News|date=11 June 2011|accessdate=16 August 2016}} Cleverley was praised by Ferguson after playing the full 90 minutes in a 2–1 victory over [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] in a pre-season friendly match.{{cite news|title=Tom Cleverley impresses Sir Alex Ferguson as Man United beat Barcelona|url=http://metro.co.uk/2011/07/31/tom-cleverley-impresses-sir-alex-ferguson-as-man-united-beat-barcelona-98029/|newspaper=Metro |location=London |date=31 July 2011|accessdate=16 August 2016}} Ferguson said that Cleverley was United's "best player" against Barcelona and he indicated that there is a strong possibility that he could be among the starting 11 in the opening fixture of the [[2011–12 Premier League]] season against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]].{{cite news |title=Cleverley could start season |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Tour-2011/Tour-2011-News/2011/Jul/Cleverley-could-start-season.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=31 July 2011 |accessdate=1 August 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121013223059/http://www.manutd.com/en/Tour-2011/Tour-2011-News/2011/Jul/Cleverley-could-start-season.aspx |archivedate=13 October 2012 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} Cleverley made his competitive debut for United in the 3–2 comeback win over [[Manchester derby|derby]] rivals [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] in the [[2011 FA Community Shield]]. He came on as a second-half substitute for [[Michael Carrick]] after United went 2–0 down at half time, and assisted [[Nani]]'s equaliser, after a pass and move build up.{{cite news|title=Never write off Manchester United|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/man-city-vs-man-utd/235241|publisher=Sky Sports|date=7 August 2011|accessdate=16 August 2016}} [[File:Cleverly + welbeck.jpg|thumb|upright|Cleverley signing memorabilia alongside [[Danny Welbeck]] in 2011]] He started his first Premier League match for Manchester United on 14 August 2011, playing the full 90 minutes away to West Bromwich Albion in the first match of the 2011–12 season.{{cite news |first=Saj |last=Chowdhury |title=West Brom 1–2 Man Utd |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/14435075.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=14 August 2011 |accessdate=14 August 2011}} After impressing in his opening match, Cleverley started Manchester United's second match of the campaign against [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] on 22 August, getting an assist in the process.{{citation needed|date=April 2016}} He played the full match against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] on 28 August 2011, which Manchester United won 8–2.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/14606020|title=Manchester United 8–2 Arsenal|publisher=BBC Sport|date=28 August 2011|accessdate=16 August 2016}} Cleverley sustained a ligament damage in his foot after being tackled heavily by Bolton's [[Kevin Davies]] in the 3rd minute of United's next match, a 5–0 away victory at Bolton Wanderers.[http://www.metro.co.uk/sport/875071-tom-cleverley-injury-overshadows-manchester-united-win-at-bolton "Tom Cleverley injury overshadows Manchester victory win at Bolton"]. ''Metro''. London. 10 September 2011. It was later confirmed by the club that he would be sidelined for a month with the injury.{{cite news |title=Cleverley out for a month with ankle injury |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/14868722.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=11 September 2011 |accessdate=11 September 2011}} The following month in October 2011, Cleverley signed a new contract keeping him at the club until 2015.{{cite news|title=Tom Cleverley signs new four-year deal at Manchester United|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/news/2896/premier-league/2011/10/10/2704573/tom-cleverley-signs-new-four-year-deal-at-manchester-united|publisher=Goal.com|date=10 October 2011|accessdate=16 August 2016}} On 25 October 2011, Cleverley made his return from injury in the League Cup, a 3–0 win against [[Aldershot Town F.C.|Aldershot Town]].{{cite news|title=Manchester United's mix of old and new sink Aldershot Town in Carling Cup|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2011/oct/25/aldershot-town-manchester-united-carling-cup|newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=25 October 2011|accessdate=16 August 2016}} He made another appearance 4 days later, away to Everton, where he played for 56 minutes and they went on to win 1–0.{{cite news|title=Everton 0–1 Manchester United|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/15413579|publisher=BBC Sport|date=29 October 2011|accessdate=16 August 2016}} Cleverley played in a more advanced midfield role, linking defence with attack and was arguably Manchester United's best player.{{cite news|title=Everton 0 Manchester United 1: Panic over as Ferguson shuts up shop|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2055006/Everton-0-Manchester-United-1-Javier-Hernandez-scores-winner.html|newspaper=Daily Mail |location=London |date=29 October 2011|accessdate=16 August 2016}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}} He left the field of play after 57 minutes due to an ankle injury, but his performance was later hailed by his manager, Alex Ferguson, as "outstanding".{{cite news|title=Sir Alex Ferguson full of praise for Michael Owen & Dimitar Berbatov as Manchester United recover from derby humiliation with League Cup win|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/news/2920/league-cup/2011/10/25/2728165/sir-alex-ferguson-full-of-praise-for-michael-owen-dimitar|publisher=Goal.com|date=25 October 2011|accessdate=16 August 2016}} Although his injury was initially less serious that kept him sidelined for weeks,{{cite news|title=Tom Cleverley out, Rio Ferdinand in for Manchester United|url=https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/tom-cleverley-out-rio-ferdinand-874736 |newspaper=Manchester Evening News|date=1 November 2011|accessdate=16 August 2016}} Cleverley's injury was sidelined even further until Christmas.{{cite news|title=Reds blow: Manchester United's Tom Cleverley out until Christmas|url=https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/reds-blow-manchester-uniteds-tom-876311|newspaper=Manchester Evening News|date=18 November 2011|accessdate=16 August 2016}} On 20 January 2012, Ferguson stated "I am hopeful in 10 days' time he will be training then we can kick on." Cleverley was due to return for the match at Old Trafford against Liverpool on 11 February 2012,{{cite news| url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/15795142.stm | publisher=BBC Sport | title=Cleverley close to making return}} but he was an unused substitute.{{cite news|title=Manchester United 2–1 Liverpool|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/16884839 |publisher=BBC Sport|date=11 February 2012|accessdate=16 August 2016}} He eventually returned in a [[UEFA Europa League]] 2–0 away win against [[AFC Ajax|Ajax]] at the [[Amsterdam Arena]].{{cite news|title=AFC Ajax 0–2 Manchester United|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/16959062 |publisher=BBC Sport|date=16 February 2012|accessdate=16 August 2016}} However, since his return, Cleverley appeared in the first team occasionally towards the end of the season and made seventeen appearance in all competitions. Despite this, Cleverley said the season, quoting: "I've had some bad luck and now I have just got to get on with it. From a great start it became the hardest season of my life. But it has made me mentally stronger."{{cite news|title=Tom Cleverley: Playing for United, life just cannot get better –now I want that feeling back again|url=https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/tom-cleverley-playing-for-united-life-688770|newspaper=Manchester Evening News|date=23 May 2012|accessdate=16 August 2016}} ====2012–13 season==== In the 2012–13 season, Cleverley managed to regain his first-team place at the club at the start of the season following his performance in the Olympics 2012.{{cite news|title=Van Persie arrival is 'massive boost' for United title hopes, says Carrick|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2188993/Robin-Van-Persie-arrival-massive-boost-Manchester-United-title-hopes-says-Michael-Carrick.html|newspaper=Daily Mail |location=London |date=16 August 2012|accessdate=16 August 2016}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}} On 26 September 2012, he scored his first goal, in a 2–1 win against Newcastle United in the [[EFL Cup|League Cup]].[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19645229 "Manchester United 2–1 Newcastle United"]. BBC Sport. 26 September 2012. Retrieved 27 September 2012. His first league goal was on 7 October 2012, also against Newcastle United.{{cite news|title=Newcastle United 0 Manchester United 3: RVP crosses the line as Fergie finds answer|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2214185/Newcastle-0-Manchester-United-3-Match-report.html|newspaper=Daily Mail |location=London |date=7 October 2012|accessdate=16 August 2016}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}} He scored his second league goal on 15 December with a fine first-time finish from the edge of the area in a 3–1 win against Sunderland.[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20650239 "Manchester United 3–1 Sunderland"] BBC Sport. 15 December 2012. Retrieved 15 December 2012. On 5 January 2013, Cleverley scored a goal from a [[Javier Hernández]] cross in a 2–2 draw against West Ham United in a third Round [[FA Cup]] tie.[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20863490 "West Ham 2–2 Man Utd"] BBC Sport. 5 January 2013. Retrieved 1 February 2013. However, he struggled to regain his first-team place, and spent most of the season on the substitutes bench despite making 22 appearances, which was enough to earn him a Premier League winner's medal.{{cite news|title=Tom Cleverley eyes another title with Manchester United|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11667/8834107/tom-cleverley-eyes-another-title-with-manchester-united|publisher=Sky Sports|date=21 July 2013|accessdate=16 August 2016}} ====2013–14 season==== In the 2013–14 season, under the new management of [[David Moyes]], Cleverley found himself competing in a midfielder spot with newly signing [[Marouane Fellaini]]{{cite news|title=Tom Cleverley could be squeezed out of Manchester United squad|url=https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/tom-cleverley-could-squeezed-out-5873232|newspaper=Manchester Evening News|date=10 September 2013|accessdate=16 August 2016}} and also began playing in a deep position.{{cite news|title=Cleverley benfiting from more advanced role|url=https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/tom-cleverley-benefitting-more-advanced-6445724|newspaper=Manchester Evening News|date=25 December 2013|accessdate=16 August 2016}} On 15 December 2013, Cleverley scored in a 3–0 victory over [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]].[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25287546 "Aston Villa 0–3 Manchester United"]. BBC Sport. 15 December 2013. Retrieved 26 March 2014. Due to Manchester United's underperformance during the season, Cleverley came under strong criticism by Manchester United supporters{{cite news|title=Tom Cleverley: I'm scapegoat for Manchester United's struggles|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11667/9160886/tom-cleverley-im-scapegoat-for-manchester-uniteds-struggles|publisher=Sky Sports|date=11 February 2014|accessdate=16 August 2016}} and a petition was even created to ban Cleverley from being included for the England squad in [[2014 FIFA World Cup]].{{cite news|title=Petition to ban Tom Cleverley for England's World Cup squad has over 4000 signatures|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/petition-to-ban-tom-cleverley-for-englands-world-cup-squad-has-over-4000-signatures-9162376.html|newspaper=The Independent |location=London |date=1 March 2014|accessdate=16 August 2016}} The petition was criticised by manager Moyes and [[Roy Hodgson]].{{cite news|title=David Moyes hits out at petition against Tom Cleverley going to World Cup|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/mar/07/david-moyes-tom-cleverley-online-petition-england-world-cup|newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=7 March 2014|accessdate=16 August 2016}} The criticism on Cleverley further increased when he was offered a new contract.{{cite news|title=Tom Cleverley to be handed a new contract by David Moyes to keep him at Manchester United for five more years|url=http://metro.co.uk/2014/03/09/tom-cleverley-to-be-handed-a-new-contract-by-david-moyes-to-keep-him-at-manchester-united-for-five-more-years-4493215/ |newspaper=Metro |location=London |date=9 March 2014 |accessdate=16 August 2016}} Cleverley later ended the 2014–15 season, making 32 appearances and scoring once in all competitions.{{citation needed|date=April 2017}} With the signings of [[Ander Herrera]], [[Ángel Di María]], [[Daley Blind]], [[Luke Shaw]] and [[Radamel Falcao]] for the 2014–15 season, Cleverley found himself on the fringes of the Manchester United squad under new manager [[Louis van Gaal]], who had taken over from David Moyes over the summer.{{cite news|title=Manchester United manager Louis van Gaal says clear-out improved dressing room atmosphere at Old Trafford|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/manchester-united/11094429/Manchester-United-manager-Louis-van-Gaal-says-clear-out-improved-dressing-room-atmosphere-at-Old-Trafford.html |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |date=13 September 2014|accessdate=16 August 2016}} As such, he attracted interest from a number of clubs, including Aston Villa and Everton. Aston Villa made an initial bid of £8 million for Cleverley, but baulked at his wage demands.{{cite news|title=Manchester United accept £8m bid for Tom Cleverley as Paul Lambert prepares for talks with Fabian Delph|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/aston-villa/11062565/Manchester-United-accept-8m-bid-for-Tom-Cleverley-as-Paul-Lambert-prepares-for-talks-with-Fabian-Delph.html |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |date=28 August 2014|accessdate=16 August 2016}} Everton then came in with an offer of £5 million that was rejected, before Villa revived their interest with a loan bid on 1 September 2014.{{cite news|title=Tom Cleverley to stay at Manchester United as midfielder sees moves to Everton and Aston Villa break down|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2740195/Tom-Cleverley-set-stay-Manchester-United-midfielder-sees-moves-Everton-Aston-Villa-break-down.html|newspaper=Daily Mail |location=London |date=1 September 2014|accessdate=16 August 2016}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}}{{Better source|reason=Tabloid sourcing is against Wikipedia guidelines for biographies.|date=January 2019}} Both of these never materialised and Cleverley was expected to stay at Manchester United.{{Better source|reason=Tabloid sourcing is against Wikipedia guidelines for biographies.|date=January 2019}} ====Aston Villa (loan)==== [[File:Santi Cazorla on the ball 1 (16395664056).jpg|thumb|upright|Cleverley (centre, in white) playing for [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] in 2015.]] The transfer was completed at around 01:15 in the morning of 2 September, shortly after the expiry of a two-hour extension to the transfer deadline granted by the Premier League, but the transfer was eventually ratified later that afternoon after Aston Villa argued that they had completed the relevant paperwork before the deadline.{{cite news |title=Tom Cleverley: Aston Villa sign Man Utd midfielder on loan |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29026581 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=2 September 2014 |accessdate=2 September 2014}}{{cite news |first=Jamie |last=Jackson |title=Tom Cleverley makes loan move from Manchester United to Aston Villa |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/sep/02/tom-cleverley-move-loan-aston-villa-manchester-united |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=2 September 2014 |accessdate=2 September 2014}} Following his loan move with just a year left on his United contract, Cleverley said that his career at Old Trafford was over.{{cite news|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11677/9465443/premier-league-tom-cleverley-admits-man-utd-career-over-after-aston-villa-move |title=Premier League: Tom Cleverley admits Man Utd career over after Aston Villa move |publisher=Sky Sports |date=12 September 2014 |accessdate=12 September 2014}} Cleverley made his Aston Villa debut on 13 September 2014 in a 1–0 win over Liverpool.{{cite news|title=Liverpool 0–1 Aston Villa|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29090587|publisher=BBC Sport|date=13 September 2014|accessdate=16 August 2016}} His manager [[Paul Lambert]] denied rumours that there was a clause in Cleverly's contract that he must start him when fit, and defended the player after he was cheered sarcastically by some Aston Villa supporters when substituted in matches.{{cite news|title=Manchester United midfielder Tom Cleverley starting on merit – Lambert|url=https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-midfielder-tom-cleverley-8610696|newspaper=Manchester Evening News|date=9 February 2015|accessdate=16 August 2016}} At one point, Cleverley's performance resulted a confrontation with then the club's assistant manager, [[Roy Keane]].{{cite news|title=Man United legend Keane did confront Cleverley – Lambert|url=https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/man-united-legend-keane-confront-8312303|newspaper=Manchester Evening News|date=18 December 2014|accessdate=16 August 2016}} Cleverley lost his first-team place following a new management of [[Tim Sherwood]], but managed to redeem himself soon after.{{cite news|title=Tom Cleverley – where did it all go wrong for former Man Utd midfielder?|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/manchester-united/11431986/Tom-Cleverley-where-did-it-all-go-wrong-for-former-Man-Utd-midfielder.html |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |date=24 February 2015|accessdate=16 August 2016}} On 25 April 2015, he scored his first goal for the club in a 3–2 defeat to Manchester City.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32362999 |title=Manchester City 3–2 Aston Villa |publisher=BBC Sport |date=25 April 2015 |accessdate=25 April 2015}} He scored again in the following match, a 3–2 win at home to Everton.[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32460322 "Aston Villa 3–2 Everton"]. BBC Sport. 2 May 2015. Retrieved 2 May 2015. He scored for the third match in a row for the first time in a 1–0 win at home to West Ham United.[https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/32561783 "Aston Villa 1–0 West Ham United"]. BBC Sport. 9 May 2015. Retrieved 9 May 2015. His performance helped the club avoid relegation and retained their Premier League status for another season.{{cite news|title=Tim Sherwood lauds Aston Villa match-winner Tom Cleverley as they edge to safety|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/tim-sherwood-lauds-aston-villa-5670263 |newspaper=Daily Mirror |location=London |date=9 May 2015|accessdate=16 August 2016}}{{Better source|reason=Wikipedia guidelines state that tabloid sourcing should not be used for biographies.|date=January 2019}} Cleverley played all six matches in Aston Villa's FA Cup campaign and started in the [[2015 FA Cup Final]] at [[Wembley Stadium]], where the team were defeated 4–0 by Arsenal on 30 May 2015.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/32856754|title=Arsenal 4–0 Aston Villa|date=14 July 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=16 August 2016}} With his contract expiring at the end of the 2014–15 season, Cleverley was expected to be among Manchester United players to leave the club for good.{{cite news|title=Louis van Gaal set to axe England midfielder in summer clear-out|url=http://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/561805/Manchester-United-Louis-Van-Gaal-Axe-Tom-Cleverley |newspaper=Daily Express |location=London |date=5 May 2015|accessdate=16 August 2016}}{{Better source|reason=Wikipedia guidelines state that tabloid sourcing should not be used for biographies.|date=January 2019}} It was later confirmed that Cleverley was released by the club, along with four other players.{{cite web|url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2015/Jun/manchester-united-retained-list-thorpe-evans-amos-mcconnell.aspx|title=Manchester United release five players|publisher=Manchester United F.C.|date=10 June 2015|accessdate=16 August 2016|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150610182204/http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2015/Jun/manchester-united-retained-list-thorpe-evans-amos-mcconnell.aspx|archivedate=10 June 2015 |deadurl=no}} ===Everton=== Following the expiration of his contract with Manchester United, Cleverley joined Everton on 1 July 2015, signing a five-year contract.{{cite news |title=Everton to sign Tom Cleverley from Manchester United |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33031207 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=5 June 2015 |accessdate=5 June 2015}} Cleverley previously was on the verge of joining Aston Villa on a permanent basis, but was in favour of joining Everton at the end of the season.{{cite news|title=Tom Cleverley set to reject Aston Villa move in favour of Everton switch|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/tom-cleverley-set-reject-aston-5291723 |newspaper=Daily Mirror |location=London |date=7 March 2015|accessdate=16 August 2016}}{{Better source|reason=Wikipedia guidelines state that tabloid sourcing should not be used for biographies.|date=January 2019}} Cleverley made his Everton debut in the opening match of the season, where he played in the left–midfielder position and played 90 minutes, in a 2–2 draw against Watford.{{cite news|title=Everton 2–2 Watford|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33744642|publisher=BBC Sport|date=8 August 2015|accessdate=16 August 2016}} However, during a match against Tottenham Hotspur, Cleverley suffered a malleolar injury and was sidelined between six and eight weeks.{{cite news|title=Everton midfielder Tom Cleverley out for 6 to 8 weeks – but has not broken his ankle|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/everton-midfielder-tom-cleverley-out-6360219 |newspaper=Daily Mirror |location=London |date=1 September 2015|accessdate=16 August 2016}} After two months without playing, Cleverley finally made his return to the first team against [[James McCarthy (footballer)|James McCarthy]] in the 68th minutes, in a 3–3 draw against [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|Bournemouth]] on 28 November 2015.{{cite news|title=AFC Bournemouth 3–3 Everton|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/34887539|publisher=BBC Sport|date=28 November 2015|accessdate=16 August 2016}} Cleverley scored his first goal for the club on 26 December 2015, when he headed in a last-minute winner for the Toffees against Newcastle United.{{cite news|title=Newcastle United 0–1 Everton|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35139941|publisher=BBC Sport|date=26 December 2015|accessdate=16 August 2016}} Between 3 February 2016 and 6 February 2016, Cleverley provided three assists against Newcastle United (once) and Stoke City, which both of these matches were a 3–0 win.{{cite news|title=Everton 3–0 Newcastle United|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35416325|publisher=BBC Sport|date=3 February 2016|accessdate=16 August 2016}}{{cite news|title=Stoke City 0–3 Everton|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35447704|publisher=BBC Sport|date=6 February 2016|accessdate=16 August 2016}} Cleverley then scored and set up one of the goal, in a 2–1 win over Bournemouth on 20 April 2016.{{cite news|title=Everton 2–1 AFC Bournemouth|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/36118581|publisher=BBC Sport|date=2 April 2016|accessdate=16 August 2016}} In his first season at Everton, Cleverley finished the season, making 22 appearances and scoring three times. In his second season, however, Cleverley found himself behind a pecking order in the first team under the new management of [[Ronald Koeman]].{{cite news|title=Five Everton players who must improve now transfer window is shut|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/five-everton-players-who-must-11838977|work=Liverpool Echo|date=3 September 2016|accessdate=22 October 2017}} As a result, Cleverley found his first team hard to come by, due to "looks ill-suited to a team demanding strength, nous and 90-minute energy" as expected by Koeman and would appear on the substitute bench.{{cite news|title=Everton team news v Burnley – Barkley and Mirallas return to the side|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/everton-team-news-v-burnley-12063702|work=Liverpool Echo|date=22 October 2016|accessdate=22 October 2017}}
{{cite news|title=Why Everton boss Koeman is discovering the limitations of the squad Martinez left him|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/everton-boss-koeman-discovering-limitations-11997454|work=Liverpool Echo|date=8 October 2016|accessdate=22 October 2017}} Having have his first team limited to making five starts in twelve appearances without scoring, it was expected that Cleverley would leave the club in January{{cite news|title=Everton boss Koeman pondering Tom Cleverley January exit|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/everton-boss-koeman-pondering-tom-12392483|work=Liverpool Echo|date=1 January 2017|accessdate=22 October 2017}}
{{cite news|title=Koeman to wield Everton axe on raft of players|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/koeman-wield-everton-axe-raft-12349733|work=Liverpool Echo|date=20 December 2016|accessdate=22 October 2017}} ===Return to Watford=== On 12 January 2017, Cleverley joined Premier League club Watford on loan until the end of the 2016–17 season, with a view to a permanent transfer, after failing to establish himself at Everton.{{cite news|title=Tom Cleverley: Everton midfielder joins Watford on loan|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38593150|publisher=BBC Sport|date=12 January 2017|accessdate=6 April 2017}} He re-debut for the club two days later, coming on as a second-half substitute, in a 0–0 draw against Middlesbrough.{{cite news|title=Watford 0 – 0 Middlesbrough|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38539448|publisher=BBC Sport|date=14 January 2017|accessdate=22 October 2017}} He then played a vital role in the next two matches against [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|Bournemouth]] and Arsenal.{{cite news|title=Benik Afobe earns point for Bournemouth in Watford draw|url=http://www.watfordobserver.co.uk/news/15039510.Benik_Afobe_earns_point_for_Bournemouth_in_Watford_draw/|work=Watford Observer|date=21 January 2017|accessdate=22 October 2017}}
{{cite news|title=Sensational Watford stun Arsenal|url=http://www.watfordobserver.co.uk/sport/15060860.Watford_pull_off_stunning_win_over_Arsenal/|work=Watford Observer|date=31 January 2017|accessdate=22 October 2017}} Having quickly made an impact for the side, it was announced on 31 March 2017 that Cleverley would join Watford permanently on 1 July on a five-year contract for an undisclosed fee.{{cite news|title=Watford exercise option to sign Tom Cleverley from Everton|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11686/10819249/watford-exercise-option-to-sign-tom-cleverley-from-everton|publisher=Sky Sports|date=31 March 2017|accessdate=25 July 2017}}
{{cite news|title=Walter Mazzarri would be 'very happy' to see Tom Cleverley make Watford move permanent from Everton|url=http://www.watfordobserver.co.uk/sport/15084276.Mazzarri_eager_to_extend_Cleverley_s_Watford_stay/|work=Watford Observer|date=10 February 2017|accessdate=22 October 2017}} At the end of the 2016–17 season, Cleverley went on to make 17 appearances for the side. In the 2017–18 season, Cleverley continued to feature in the first team regularly following the managerial appointment of [[Marco Silva]] and was expected to face competition for a place in the side.{{cite news|title=Tom Cleverley enjoying 'different role' as Watford's most attacking midfielder|url=http://www.watfordobserver.co.uk/sport/15546276.Cleverley_enjoying_attacking_midfield_role/|work=Watford Observer|date=20 September 2017|accessdate=22 October 2017}}
{{cite news|title=EXCLUSIVE – Tom Cleverley credits Marco Silva for Watford's win over Arsenal and impressive start|url=https://talksport.com/football/exclusive-tom-cleverley-credits-marco-silva-watfords-win-over-arsenal-and-impressive-start|publisher=Talksport|date=16 October 2017|accessdate=22 October 2017}} It was not until on 15 October 2017 when he scored his first goal for Watford (his first for the side in seven years), in a 2–1 win over Arsenal.{{cite news|title=Watford 2 – 1 Arsenal|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41534302|publisher=BBC Sport|date=15 October 2017|accessdate=22 October 2017}} ==International career== ===England U20=== Cleverley was called up to [[Noel Blake]]'s [[England national under-20 football team|England under-20 team]] for the first time on 12 March 2009. However, following a dislocated shoulder suffered while on loan at Leicester City a few days later, he was forced to withdraw from the squad, and was replaced by [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] midfielder [[Adam Clayton (footballer)|Adam Clayton]].{{cite news |first=Nicholas |last=Veevers |title=Squad named for QPR |url=http://www.thefa.com/England/MensUnder20s/NewsAndFeatures/2009/Squad_named_for_QPR.aspx |publisher=The Football Association |date=12 March 2009 |accessdate=5 April 2009}} Cleverley eventually made his Under-20 debut on 11 August 2009 in a 5–0 friendly win over Montenegro at [[The Hawthorns]], missing an early penalty but going on to score two second-half goals.{{cite news |first=Nicholas |last=Veevers |title=Five star England cruise to victory |url=http://www.thefa.com/England/mens-u20s/News/match-centre/2009/EnglandMontenegro/england_montenegro_report_110809 |publisher=The Football Association |date=11 August 2009 |accessdate=18 May 2011}} ===England U21=== Cleverley made his England U-21 debut as substitute for [[Junior Stanislas]] in a 2–1 win away to [[Macedonia national under-21 football team|Macedonia]] on 4 September 2009.{{cite news |first=Jamie |last=Bradbury |title=England made to work for opening win |url=http://www.thefa.com/England/mens-under-21s/News/match-centre/2009/MacedoniaEngland/report_040909 |publisher=The Football Association |date=4 September 2009 |accessdate=18 May 2011}} ===Great Britain Olympic team=== On 2 July 2012, Cleverley was named in [[Stuart Pearce]]'s 18-man [[Great Britain Olympic football team|Great Britain]] squad for the [[Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament|2012 Summer Olympics]].{{cite news |title=Pearce names squad |url=http://www1.skysports.com/olympics/story/15234/7859286 |publisher=Sky Sports |date=2 July 2012 |accessdate=2 July 2012}} On 20 July 2012, Cleverley played in a warm up match for the Olympics at the [[Riverside Stadium]] in [[Middlesbrough]] against [[Brazil national under-23 football team]].{{cite news|last1=White|first1=Duncan|date=20 July 2012|title=London 2012 Olympics: Great Britain 0 Brazil 2|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/olympics/football/9416665/London-2012-Olympics-Great-Britain-0-Brazil-2.html|newspaper=The Telegraph|location=London|accessdate=22 October 2017}} The match finished 2–0 to Brazil, with Cleverley playing the full match. He played the full match in the tournament's opening fixture against [[Senegal national under-23 football team|Senegal]]; which ended 1–1. In the second group match against the [[United Arab Emirates national under-23 football team|United Arab Emirates]], Cleverley was instrumental in GB's victory.{{cite news|last1=Cross|first1=John|date=29 July 2012|title=Team GB 3–1 UAE: Ryan Giggs insists the team are united despite Welsh players anthem snub|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/match-reports/team-gb-3-1-uae-scott-1186255|newspaper=Daily Mirror|location=London|accessdate=22 October 2017}} He set up the winner with a through-ball for [[Daniel Sturridge]] and generally impressed with his range of passing.{{cite web|last=Fletcher|first=Paul|title=Team GB suffer defeat to Brazil|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/olympics/18929315|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=21 July 2012}} ===England senior team=== In August 2011, he was called up to the [[England national football team|England senior team]] by [[Fabio Capello]] for a friendly against the [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands]].{{cite news |title=Man Utd midfielder Tom Cleverley called up by England |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/14445029 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=8 August 2011 |accessdate=8 August 2011}} but did not end up playing as the match was cancelled on 8 August by [[The Football Association]] after the [[2011 London riots|riots in London]].{{cite news |title=England match against the Netherlands off after riots |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/14454137 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=9 August 2011 |accessdate=9 August 2011}} He received another call-up for the [[UEFA Euro 2012 qualifying Group G|Euro 2012 qualifying]] matches with [[Bulgaria national football team|Bulgaria]] and [[Wales national football team|Wales]] later in September 2011 alongside fellow new England additions and club-mates [[Phil Jones (footballer born 1992)|Phil Jones]] and [[Chris Smalling]], but did not end up playing.{{cite news|title=Phil Jones, Danny Welbeck make England squad – but no place for Rio Ferdinand|url=https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/phil-jones-danny-welbeck-make-872143|newspaper=Manchester Evening News|date=3 October 2011|accessdate=16 August 2016}} He made his debut a year later in a 2–1 win against [[Italy national football team|Italy]] on 15 August 2012.{{cite news |first=Alistair |last=Magowan |title=England 2–1 Italy |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19238374 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=15 August 2012 |accessdate=18 August 2012}} He made his competitive debut on 7 September 2012, playing the full 90 minutes in a 5–0 win away to [[Moldova national football team|Moldova]] during [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualification (UEFA)|2014 FIFA World Cup qualifying]][http://www.thefa.com/England/News/match-centre/2012/moldovavengland/teamsheets?p=ts&mid=201123 "Moldova 0–5 England"]. The Football Association. 7 September 2012. Retrieved 13 September 2012. and received praise for his performance from manager Roy Hodgson.[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19527305 "England manager Roy Hodgson hails Tom Cleverley's influence"] BBC Sport. 7 September 2012. Retrieved 13 September 2012. On 12 October 2012, playing against [[San Marino national football team|San Marino]] in a World Cup qualifier, Cleverley made 165 touches during the match, the highest ever recorded for an England player.{{cite web|url=http://news.frrole.com/o/165---tom-cleverleys-165-touches-is-t-optajoe-london|title=165 – Tom Cleverley's 165 touches|publisher=FFRole News|date=12 October 2012|accessdate=16 August 2016|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131205164315/http://news.frrole.com/o/165---tom-cleverleys-165-touches-is-t-optajoe-london|archivedate=5 December 2013|deadurl=yes}} He also made two assists in the same match as England won 5–0.{{cite web|url=http://uk.eurosport.yahoo.com/news/match-facts-england-v-san-marino-140910345.html|title=England put five past San Marino|publisher=Euro Sport|date=13 October 2012|accessdate=13 October 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121015084134/http://uk.eurosport.yahoo.com/news/match-facts-england-v-san-marino-140910345.html|archivedate=15 October 2012}} His 13th and last cap to date came in November 2013 against [[Germany national football team|Germany]].{{cite web|url=http://englandstats.com/players.php?pid=1187|title=Thomas William Cleverley|publisher=Englandstats.com|accessdate=5 October 2016}} ==Personal life== Growing up, Cleverley suffered from a childhood speech impediment and was given a nickname, "Chunks". In October 2011, Cleverley accepted substantial undisclosed libel damages over a false claim made by ''[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]]'' newspaper the previous August that he had "badgered" a girl for sex in [[Blackpool]]. Cleverley was at home with his girlfriend in [[Manchester]] when the newspaper said the incident had occurred.[http://www.irishtimes.com/newspaper/breaking/2011/1005/breaking32.html Man Utd star accepts libel damages]. ''The Irish Times''. 5 October 2011. In May 2012, Cleverley began dating ex-[[The Only Way is Essex|TOWIE]] star, [[Georgina Dorsett]] after they first met through a mutual friend.{{cite news|title=TOWIE beauty Georgina Dorsett is a Cleverley girl|url=https://www.thesun.co.uk/archives/news/647145/towie-beauty-georgina-dorsett-is-a-cleverley-girl/|work=The Sun|date=26 May 2012|accessdate=16 August 2016}} Dorsett announced her pregnancy in December 2012{{cite news|title= 'We are both very, very happy': TOWIE star Georgina Dorsett confirms she's pregnant with Man U footballer Tom Cleverley's baby|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2244457/TOWIE-star-Georgina-Dorsett-expecting-baby-Manchester-United-footballer-Tom-Cleverley.html|newspaper=Daily Mail |location=London |date=7 December 2012|accessdate=16 August 2016}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}} and gave birth to their child, a daughter, Nevaeh Rose, on 7 June 2013.{{cite news|title= 'The proudest moment of my life': Tom Cleverley and Georgina Dorsett welcome baby girl Nevaeh Rose|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2337578/Tom-Cleverley-Georgina-Dorsett-welcome-baby-girl-Nevaeh-Rose.html|newspaper=Daily Mail |location=London |date=7 June 2013|accessdate=16 August 2016}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}} The couple announced their engagement in July 2014 and were married the following year.{{cite news|title=At least someone's found the back of the net! Tom Cleverley gets over World Cup heartbreak by 'proposing to girlfriend Georgina Dorsett with £20,000 ring'|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2664174/Tom-Cleverley-gets-World-Cup-heartbreak-proposing-girlfriend-Georgina-Dorsett-20-000-ring.html|newspaper=Daily Mail |location=London |date=21 June 2014|accessdate=16 August 2016}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}}{{cite news|title=TOWIE star Georgina Dorsett marries England footballer Tom Cleverley in a lavish ceremony|url=http://www.ok.co.uk/celebrity-news/446700/make-way-for-mr-and-mrs-cleverley|magazine=OK!|date=16 June 2015|accessdate=16 August 2016}} Cleverley and Dorsett had a second child when she gave birth to a boy, Alfie, on 3 May 2016.{{cite news|title= 'He is just so beautiful': WAG Georgina Cleverley welcomes baby Albie with husband Tom... and BFF Rochelle Humes is first to visit|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-3574825/Tom-Cleverley-wife-Georgina-welcome-baby-Albie-WAG-s-BFF-Rochelle-Humes-visit.html|newspaper=Daily Mail |location=London |date=5 May 2016|accessdate=16 August 2016}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}} In October 2015, Cleverley was present in his house, with his wife and then baby daughter, when he was burgled by armed thieves and watches, designer handbags, jewellery and two [[Range Rover]]s were stolen.{{cite news|title=Former Leicester City star Tom Cleverley subjected to £175,000 armed raid|url=http://www.leicestermercury.co.uk/city-star-tom-cleverley-subjected-175-000-armed/story-27938391-detail/story.html|newspaper=Leicester Mercury|date=7 October 2015|accessdate=16 August 2016|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151011033752/http://www.leicestermercury.co.uk/City-star-Tom-Cleverley-subjected-175-000-armed/story-27938391-detail/story.html|archivedate=11
